campaign.story:
Caught in an otherworldly storm, the luxury ocean liner you were traveling on ran aground on a dinosaur island, losing all contact with the world you knew. Instead of your dream vacation, it now falls upon you and your rival aspiring leaders to forge the ragged, disorganized survivors into a functioning society. 
Your first task is to establish and defend a foothold settlement from the dinosaurs, but your curiosity will soon call you to adventure beyond the safety of the town walls.
Over the years, your city and society will grow strong, slowly adapting to the island and learning to both fear and respect the dinosaurs inhabiting it. Your new home is a land of danger and mystery, but also beauty and opportunity.  
Perseverance: Castaway Chronicles consists of Episodes 1 and 2, two standalone competitive strategy games for 1-4 players, from the designers of Anachrony, Trickerion, and Yedo. Both games are playable on their own, or can be combined to experience a highly replayable Chronicle mode with overarching mechanics and no legacy elements.
For retail and group pledges of 6 copies or more, please write us an email at sales@mindclashgames.com 
Please note that certain parts of Perseverance Castaway Chronicles are still in development. Because of that, the final look and quantity of the components shown here may slightly differ in the finished game. 
The cornerstones of every Episode, these mechanisms will stay with you for the whole saga with minor evolutions between the Episodes. 
Dice drafting and dice placement: The core mechanism of the entire series; you take Actions by drafting and placing Specialist dice from a pool. Some Specialists are better suited for certain Actions than others. 
The Assembly: Whenever the dice pool runs out, an Assembly occurs. This periodic area majority mechanism scores Followers (the games’ victory points) for establishing a presence in the city’s districts with your colored player pieces. You can do this by building Settlements, placing your Leader, and converting Specialist dice to your player color.
Influencing the Officers: The city and its forming society are developing under the guidance of the Officers’ Council. As an aspiring Leader, a good relationship with the Officers goes a long way and will reward you after the Assembly based on the strategies you’ve been pursuing. 
The way you interact with the threats and mysteries of the island is different in each Episode, giving it a unique feel and distinct identity.
Episode 1 - Dino Defense:  Build Walls, set Traps and rally Soldiers to defend against periodic Dinosaur attacks against the emerging city. Defense is often a joint effort but players are rewarded individually based on their contribution. Be careful though - failure will result in breaching Dinos, trampled Settlements and lost Followers!
Episode 2 - Exploration and Construction: Assemble exploration parties and venture beyond the walls of the established city! Undertake Adventures, capture Dinosaurs roaming the wild, and establish Outposts on the map hexes for even more die placement options.
Episode 2 - Leader Skills: Continue building relations with the Officers and they will share their tricks to help you survive and thrive! With over 30 Skills to choose from, Episode 2 offers very deep customization of your Leader and excellent replayability. 
Chronicle Mode: The standalone Episodes can be linked together in the infinitely replayable Chronicle mode. Earn a Title at the end of each game based on your performance, and accomplish the goals they provide in the next. Accomplished goals and achievements earn you Glory, which you can spend to unlock various permanent bonuses and abilities. This replayable non-legacy campaign can be wrapped up after Episode 2 but also picked up again and continued when more games in the series are released.
Solo Mode: As you rise as a leader, you will inevitably face opposition: the Dissenters. Gather Followers despite their interference: protect the city - even the Dissenters' settlements; explore the jungle - even if the Dissenters would rather stay back; and earn votes - even as the Dissenters negate your presence. Playing against them uses every feature of the game, as the Dissenters are powered by an elegant, card-driven automa designed by Dávid Turczi and developed by John Albertson, the same team that brought you the dreaded Chronossus for Anachrony.
Please note that all rulebooks are work in progress and their content and visuals are subject to change. The rulebooks under the link below will be periodically updated as we continue to develop the game after the campaign.
If you prefer watching a video instead of reading the rules, check out these tutorial videos presented on Tabletopia, courtesy of Tabletop Tutorials.
Please note that these videos have been recorded during a period of social distancing, with two of the players playing remotely. Because of that, as Edward also explains, these videos do not reflect the actual gameplay length, which would normally be a lot shorter.
Please note that these videos have been recorded during a period of social distancing, with two of the players playing remotely. Because of that, as Paul also explains, these videos do not reflect the actual gameplay length, which would normally be a lot shorter.
Both Episodes are mostly language independent, with a few English texts (such as Action names) that are not essential for the gameplay.
Due to the limited availability of the games (see Exclusivity and Availability for details) and the fact that it is always a very popular request, we decided to offer a language pack for the game, available in the three most common languages among our backers: French, German and Spanish.
These will be publishing-quality professional translations of every rulebook and player aid card in the game.
Since all games will be printed in English by default due to minimum manufacturing order quantities, the language pack will be packaged separately from your game box and we've kept their cost as low as $5.
If you are interested in the language pack, all you need to do is add an extra $5 to your pledge (now or in the Pledge manager). You will be able to choose the language you’d like in the Pledge manager, as you finalize your pledge and pay the shipping cost.
These items are optional purchases in addition to your current pledge. Please note that one Neoprene Dice Tray is included in every pledge by default, and the Dinosaur miniatures, Squishy Berries and Metal Tokens are included in the Deluxe pledge level by default.
To add an addon to your pledge, simply click Manage your Pledge, then increase your pledge amount by the total cost of the items you wish to add. In the Pledge Manager following the campaign, you will be able to allocate the funds added this way to the respective addons.
The retail versions of all previous Mindclash Games titles will also be available as addons in the Pledge Manager. 
Just like in our previous campaign, we will be using the Gamefound pledge manager platform after the Kickstarter. On this platform, you will be able to pay the shipping cost of your pledge, increase your pledge and/or choose different rewards, and add more items to your pledge. 
You will be able to access the Pledge Manager and the pricing you see on Kickstarter even if you pledged $1, but pledging the full amount during the campaign will be a tremendous help in making this project a success!
As with our previous campaigns, we will be working with shipping partners within the EU, US, Canada, Australia and Asia to provide region-friendly shipping in each of these zones. If you live in these regions, you will not have to worry about paying additional taxes or duties.
The shipping cost will be charged after the campaign, using the Gamefound pledge manager. We will be charging the actual shipping cost with a small subsidy to be able to offer you the best possible value in pledge prices. The table below contains the expected shipping cost of one copy of each pledge type. If you pledge for multiple copies, the per unit shipping cost will be lower than this.
To make sure we minimize the potential damage during fulfillment, each of the Perseverance: Castaway Chronicles Deluxe pledges will be packaged individually by the manufacturer in 7-layered cardboard boxes and carefully padded with foam padding.

REFUND POLICY
We can fully refund pledges within 10 days of the campaign’s end. You can still request a pledge cancellation after this time window but please note that we will deduct 10% for Kickstarter and payment processing fees, which we are unable to recover after 10 days. Cancellations are possible until the final production numbers are submitted to our manufacturer, about 4-5 months before the estimated delivery date.
All refunds requested more than 10 days after the closure of the campaign will either be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card. Refunds within 10 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card. Any refunds will be processed in USD.
INCOMPLETE/ UNFINISHED ORDERS
A few days after the campaign, we will send out the invitations to our pledge manager platform, Gamefound. The pledge manager will stay open until we submit the final production numbers. We will be in touch regarding the exact time frames and deadlines and will give timely heads ups in regular project updates after the campaign. Please note that if you fail to complete your order and pay for shipping within this time frame, you may receive your pledge with a delay, or we may not be able to send it to you.
SHIPPING DAMAGES
We will ship the Deluxe pledges in 7-layered, customized cardboard boxes, carefully padded with foam padding in order to avoid shipping damages. If your copy still arrives with a visible damage, please contact us at info@mindclashgames.com. All decisions on box replacements will be made on a case by case basis. Due to the difficulty and expense in replacing boxes, depending on your region, we will not be able to replace boxes with minor cosmetic damage. Thank you for your understanding.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is Mindclash Games' sixth Kickstarter campaign. Four of those campaigns have already shipped, and the fifth is already in mass production, allowing us to fully focus on the successful execution of this project.

We have been working on the Perseverance saga for almost 3 years, Although the entire saga's scope is bigger than anything we have ever done before, Episodes 1 and 2 are both about 85% complete: they have been extensively playtested and most of the art and graphic design work on them is already done. Once the campaign is finished, our focus will be on finishing the Chronicle mode and the rulebooks in various languages, both of which we expect to fit comfortably into the estimated delivery timeline.

In manufacturing, we will continue to work with Panda Games Manufacturing. They have been excellent partners for all our projects so far, and our five-year partnership is a guarantee for smooth communication and an inside-out knowledge of their processes and deadlines. We have a new, dedicated project manager hell-bent on making even our craziest component ideas a reality, and we already have detailed price quotes and manufacturing samples for everything this project entails.

Finally, we have to take into account the uncertainty of our time, mainly caused by the COVID-19 virus. Even before the worldwide quarantine in Spring, working remotely has been an integral part of our company's culture, so another lockdown would be unlikely to slow down our internal operations and delay the project. The campaign itself is only 3 weeks, but we are leaving the pledge manager open for longer than usual to give our backers enough time to consider and recover financially, if needed. Finally, we have reserved enough capital from previous projects to be able to deliver this one even in the face of unexpected financial hardship.

We highly value transparency in all our campaigns. As always, we will be in touch about our progress and important milestones via regular project updates approximately once per month, but if you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to contact us at info@mindclashgames.com.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Reusability and recyclability

Environmentally friendly factories

At Panda, we have a commitment not only to produce the best quality games in the industry, but to operate in a sustainable and ethical manner.
We believe in producing the highest quality games in the industry, so you, your friends, and your family can play them for years to come. We also believe in reducing the environmental impact of producing games. Some steps we’ve taken in that direction include using eco-friendly inks, glues, varnishes, and wraps, as well as sourcing wood from providers who use responsible forestry practices.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Stronghold Games has learned how to streamline the game publishing process and has successfully delivered games to thousands of its supporters. Our previous experiences will enable us to also deliver this project on time and we have every confidence that Terraforming Mars: Big Box will be on schedule and of the highest possible quality.

That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. Stronghold Games will use contract manufacturing to make this game, freight forwarders to get games through customs, and 3rd parties like Amazon, the US Post Office, and FEDEX to ship the games to you – we don't control everything and there are lots of opportunities for delay. We have a track record of making everything work out for backers in the end – so please be confident and supportive of our efforts to get this great game into your hands.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus 20% for Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment (usually 4 to 6 weeks before the actual shipping date), no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.
This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

DAMAGED OR INCOMPLETE PRODUCTS

We understand that all backers want to receive their items in pristine condition; however, the realities of worldwide shipping can sometimes make this difficult. We guarantee that the product you receive will be complete and all internal components in perfect condition. We will do our best to ensure that your package arrives in good condition, but all decisions on box replacements will be made on a case by case basis. Due to the difficulty and expense in replacing boxes, depending on your region, we will not be able to replace some boxes with minor cosmetic damage only.

RETURNED PRODUCTS

If you refuse to accept your package on arrival we will not issue you a refund for the cost of the pledge.

FAILURE TO RESPOND TO SURVEY

Surveys will be completed through Crowd Ox. If you fill out the survey after the designated time frame, your package may be delayed in sending to you by up to a few months. If you do not fill out the survey until after the declared end of the project, we may not be able to send it to you.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials, and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and submit your project survey results (ie, provide us with your shipping address) for your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge (at additional cost for international backers) if you complete your project survey after the 8-week window has elapsed.

If you do not accept these terms, please do not pledge on this project but instead wait for the general release.

updates.update_userinfo: Fulfillment Update - the end is in sight!
updates.update_content:
Executives,
We’re here with another update about the rolling fulfillment for your pledges. We’re nearing the end, and have hope that you’ll all see your games in the next few weeks! 
Regional Shipping Updates:

Hello terraformers,
I come bearing news! Everything is moving along, and orders are being shipped out all over the world. Overall, this massive undertaking of fulfillment is going well, but not without some issues. You can find more detailed information about your region's fulfillment below. Rolling fulfillment is a long process as we can’t ship orders for which the component pieces haven’t arrived. We appreciate your patience - overall, we’re in the middle of a month-long process. Even without a rolling fulfillment, this was a huge project that would take weeks to complete. And remember, we don’t like this rolling fulfillment any more than you do - but the sheer scope of the project (over 11 containers of games), and the vast, ongoing supply chain issues caused by COVID made it the best way to get games to you. But even if it is the best way, it certainly is showing the ugly side of the freight game that backers usually don’t see. The fact that so much progress has been made means our fulfillment centers are showing off their work ethic!

Hello executives,
I’m back only a week later with exciting news. As you may have noticed, some of you have started getting shipping notifications - and we are super excited about that! Let’s break down exactly what that means, and again ask for everyone’s patience as this is going to be a rolling fulfillment over the course of a month.

Hey backers time for a brief update!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We know everyone has either had or known someone who has had a bad experience with Kickstarting a project that doesn't deliver on its promises. As a first-time publisher, we're keenly aware of the trust you're giving us to make this project a success from start to finish. Dawnshade is the first of hopefully many games and expansions to the Dawnshade universe. We're committed to developing a trusted brand that is known for quality, reliability, and--most importantly--FUN! To this end, we've taken the time to finish and polish Dawnshade: The Watcher's Prophecy prior to releasing it on Kickstarter. The Kickstarter campaign is functionally a pre-order of the game to determine demand and how many copies we should print rather than a crowdsourced idea. The stretch goals we have chosen add content and value to the game without increasing production time and without requiring additional game testing and balancing. We feel confident in the manufacturing and shipping partners we've chosen and our ability to deliver the game by February 2021 in a way that meets or exceeds the high expectations for Dawnshade we all share.

Terms & Conditions

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active. The campaign occurs using U.S. currency (USD). Any other currency values shown throughout the campaign are estimates at the time of campaign launch. Other currency values may differ at the conclusion of the Kickstarter based on market fluctuation. Final charges will be based on each currencies exchange rate to USD at the time of payment processing. If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 12 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 12-week window has elapsed. Unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics, and can lead to project delays. For this project, we do not intend to allow this to happen, which may mean if you confirm your pledge too late, exclusive items may not be produced in sufficient quantity for your pledge. If you confirm your pledge within 12 weeks of our notification via email, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your order as entered into our pledge manager system, that title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you may be responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods. We regret we are unable to ship too P.O. Boxes. All backers that have selected "No Reward" on Kickstarter, that wish to receive a reward for the campaign, must make sure to confirm their orders by the Pledge Manager Deadline. We will announce the date for this once the Pledge Manager becomes live. All "No Reward" pledges will be treated as donations once the Pledge Manager Deadline has passed. updates.update_content:
Hail Kinship,
We wanted to send a quick update to let everyone know things are still progressing with Dawnshade. We've been receiving consistent proofs from our manufacturer in China, but the back and forth is taking longer than we would like. Each small adjustment, change, or fix requires a new set of proofs and the back and forth can sometimes take a few days. That said, we are happy with direction we are moving and are seeing measured progress.

Hail Kinship,
We just wanted to send a quick monthly update. Unfortunately we are still waiting in the queue for our production slot to get both the pre-production and mass production copies of Dawnshade made by our manufacturer in China. They are still playing catch up with the backlog of projects caused by COVID-19 shutdowns. Though not as quick as we would like, progress is being made. We are in regular communication answering questions and approving proofs. We are being told Dawnshade is slated to begin production in May, but we have not been given an exact date yet.  We're doing our best to work through details before the pre-production sample to limit the amount of fixing necessary before we go into mass production.

Hail Kinship,
Thank you all for your patience and long suffering through the Dawnshade manufacturing and delivery process. The last two months have been full of challenges, but nothing we can't overcome. We were told by our manufacturing partner we would have a pre-production copy of the game to review by now, but we do not. We met again with them today and they have run into some snags we're working through, particularly with the design of the inserts. Our aim is to have high density foam inserts that hold game components snugly and also allow players to remove sections and place them on the table for easy access during gameplay. We've been going back and forth with possible solutions and each minor change takes longer than normal to turnaround. This is primarily due to the larger situation with manufacturing in China. They continue to be backlogged because of their response to COVID. This means when we have a change, we are scheduled for the next open window to make that change, which at times can be a few weeks out. This is frustrating for everyone involved, not the least of which is you, our backers.

updates.update_userinfo: Unfortunate news from China - Production Update
updates.update_content: We received news from our manufacturer today that though they were hoping to have the pre-production copy of Dawnshade created and shipped to us by the end of this month before Chinese New Year, they have been unable to do so. From what we've been told, the Chinese government normally mandates a 2 week vacation the first 2 weeks in February for Chinese New Year. This year in response to COVID, they have decided to stagger the workforce's vacation into 4 segments to alleviate travel congestion. What this means is a quarter of the workforce was sent on vacation mid Jan. Another will be sent away the beginning of Feb and another mid Feb and another the beginning of Mar.

Hail Kinship,
Happy Holidays to everyone. We know it has been a challenging year for everyone, but we're also counting ourselves blessed because Dawnshade was successfully launched amid all the COVID uncertainty thanks to you and we are well underway in getting it to your gaming tables.

campaign.story:
Nemesis Lockdown is a standalone expansion to the hit Board Game Nemesis (BGG rank overall #33, thematic #10). It builds on the tense, cinematic experience Nemesis is known for, adding even more opportunities for emergent, dramatic gameplay. Become an unlikely survivor, locked in an underground base with something terrifying. Turn up your paranoia, as you try to guess what other players are up to, or what the contingency plan is. Work to learn the weaknesses of your nemesis – or run like hell. Switch off the lights in someone’s lab section. Take a dangerous trek to the outside bunker. And whatever you do, be ready for unexpected!
The game comes with all the components needed for a cinematic Sci-Fi horror experience and doesn't require the Nemesis Core Box.
Nemesis: Lockdown offers 1-5 player semi or full co-op experience that takes around  90-120 minutes and will be different every run! This stand-alone expansion also works with majority of the previous Nemesis content: other Alien races and most of the characters. 
During this campaign you can also get classic Nemesis Core Box (only in English) and all the previous expansion (in 6 different Languages)! 

Click for more info!


Nemesis Lockdown previews 
Nemesis Core Box
Nemesis: Lockdown setting
I should have known when they asked us to prepare the landing platform. There are only two reasons to make a night sample transfer. It’s either too urgent to wait, or it’s a black op. Both spell trouble.
My survival instinct, honed by twenty years of work in the Sample-Return Receiving Facilities, was screaming, considering the rumours that reached even our remote site.
Maybe if I bailed right there, I wouldn’t be crouching in a dark lab, sweaty palms clutching a scalpel, and this damned soft voice repeating over my head: “Containment Breach, Containment Breach…”
Things only got bleaker when they told us there would be human BSL-5-ET subjects coming. Extra-terrestrial samples and living people don’t usually mix. They SHOULD NEVER mix. Something went really bad out there, and we got caught in it.
When Martinsen and Sovich processed the first sample, I only caught a peek from behind the armored glass. There was one word on the container.
“Nemesis.”
I wasn’t there when the actual breach happened. There were screams over the intercom. The main power went out. Soon, I saw Martinsen and one of the human subjects running to me from the isolation ward elevator, as if the devil himself chased them. I’ve seen it for a split second, before they were caught. I’d rather take my chances with the devil, than with the thing that took them.
Now, it’s been fifteen minutes since I last heard any shots. The pain in my mangled leg subsides. I get up and slowly make my way to one of the security stations. Am I the only one left? No, thank god! Sovich is still kicking. I have her on a live feed from the main terminal. She’s…
Changing the logs! Switching her name for mine. Frigging rat! When the board learns we had a containment breach, there will be hell to pay, and she wants to make sure the bill is on my name.
Now, she turns towards the main console. In the middle of it, under the protective glass, is the A3-5 button, a big chunk of red plastic. They told us it enables the “Code Red Emergency Protocol” but we had no clearance to know what the protocol actually is.
Don’t do it, Sovich. You might just nuke us. Don’t…
Of course she does. She wants to play the good girl, an upstanding citizen.
Well, there’s still time to fix everything. No one will call until morning. We’re on a dark side of the planet now, blocking all signals. I need to get topside, to the secondary console in the other building. Re-write the logs, access the classified procedures, and see what new trouble she got us into.
The only things between me and my salvation is a broken airlock, a long stretch of hellish surface, and enough gamma radiation to hard-boil an egg. I’m betting these things can’t walk outside.
That would be too frigging unfair...
Gameplay details
This time, you are trapped inside the laboratory hidden somewhere on Mars. This construction has several floors you will be able to travel through via elevators or stairs.
Each section of the board will have a separate power supply that can be cut off at any second. When that happens, elevators stop working, and the corridors sink into pitch-black darkness. This offers an interesting way to slow down the alien pursuit … or to trap other players.
Movement and space management has a very different, tenser feel in Lockdown!
Lockdown will come with an entirely new mechanic called the “Contingency Order.” It represents one of many possible emergency plans (such as “nuke the station” ). The only way to discover which one is active is through investigation and elimination.
Obviously, it’s up to you whether you’re going to share your hard-earned knowledge with other players.
Having a detailed energy system for different sectors of the board allowed us to put more emphasis on the light – or the lack of it. This makes room for more interactions between players and makes controlling the flow of energy through different sections one of the important elements of the game.
There are also items that are a source of light, but they won't last long and will require energy. You may always decide to go through the darkness, but this will make card Events more dangerous and incurs other penalties, such as using different (less accurate) die for shooting.
Lockdown comes with a set of new, freshly designed rooms that thematically reflect a secret base on the surface of Mars. It also contains a whole new set of neutral items, character-specific items, and craftable items.
In our previous campaign, we loved the experience of working with the community to create a new alien race, or to determine the look and professions of the crew members. This led us down a very creative path, and brought amazing, diverse ideas into the game!
With Lockdown, we want to follow up on this experience. In this Kickstarter campaign, you will not only be buying a game, but you'll take part in its creation too!
Nemesis Lockdown comes with high quality, non-essential companion app. It will provide many exciting gameplay modes, a dedicated soundtrack, as well as support for an advanced solo mode.
Thanks to the app, we bring new depth to solo play that will now include the "traitor" tension from semi-cooperative games, as you will never know if you can trust what the app tells you.

campaign.story:
The Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast has been producing our flagship podcast since 2011 and has since added The Secret Cabal Express and Lords of the Dungeon our Roleplaying Game Show. The Founders and Lords will continue to bring you weekly, high quality, irreverent nonsense about tabletop gaming and more.
The goal of this campaign is to ensure that The Secret Cabal continue producing weekly audio and video tabletop gaming media. To do this to full capacity we need to raise enough funds to keep Jamie in the full-time position of producer and editor of our content.  Below are just a few of the audio productions and videos that we plan to produce in 2020 - and the list doesn't end there! Check out my video talking about our plan for 2020. 
PLAY



Shipping Costs
Shipping is the most difficult part of running any Kickstarter. We are running this project to facilitate making as much content as we can and too many campaigns have been sunk by botched shipping. Each pledge level including physical rewards (Except the all-in pledge) will have a shipping and handling cost added to it. THIS DOES NOT INCLUDE SHIPPING FOR ADD-ON ITEMS. All add-on items will have individual shipping added based on size, weight and destination.
US Shipping: $6 ($5 for just promos)
Canadian Shipping: $13 ($10 for just promos)
Everywhere Else: $16 ($15 for just promos)
IMPORTANT: Double Secret Grand Master: ALL-IN shipping will not be charged during the Kickstarter but will be calculated and charged in the pledge manager based on it's destination. This pledge will require multiple shipments from different points of origin and will be determined in the same manner as if each item was add-on in the pledge manager. For international backers of this pledge level, please see note below regarding Game Topper Mats.
IMPORTANT: Game Topper Mats and International Shipping. All pledges and add-ons including Game Topper Mats being shipped outside of the United States and Canada will be VERY expensive due to the size, shape and weight of the item. We're talking $60+. Please be aware of this when deciding to pledge for a Game Topper Mat.
Shipping For Add-Ons
   In the post-campaign pledge manager, shipping costs will be added per add-on item based on size and destination.
We very much appreciate your understanding as we are attempting to minimize our risk and make sure you get all your goodies!
Why No Backer Dinners This Year?
As you know, convention season is up in the air, and it looks like most of the summer conventions and likely all of the fall conventions will be canceled. Because of this uncertainty, we have decided not to offer the backer dinners at this time. If an opportunity arises for us to host a backer dinner later in the year, we will consider how to handle it at that time. Sorry!
It stinks because I was planning a really special Gen Con dinner this year that would work in tandem with our Gen Con meetup (which also won't be happening). I had it all worked out too... CURSES!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Secret Cabal Gaming Podcast has been running for nearly 9 years, releasing weekly podcast content which has been consistent and will continue to be so barring illness, accident or other unforeseen disaster. 

COVID-19
We live in a strange time right now, and the global pandemic we are currently experiencing makes everything a bit more challenging. Podcasts are easy. We can continue to record our podcasts remotely instead of in person as we normally do, but video work with the other Founders has become difficult. When social distancing restrictions begin to lighten, you will again see the other Founders back in action on the YouTube channel.

Regarding fulfillment. At this point, I do not know how long the Covid-19 crisis will continue, and though we assume by the time fulfillment of our physical rewards comes due, we will have all of the items produced and ready to ship. BUT, as you know, the world is moving at a different pace right now, and I will be sure to keep everyone updated throughout the year, particularly during the production, and share the timelines I am provided.

Tiny Epic Pirates is a 45 minute, 1-4 player game of high-seas adventure, utilizing a variable RONDEL action system and action combo-ing!
Every player's Rondel is unique, every game!
In Tiny Epic Pirates you take control of a Pirate ship with the goal of burying vast amounts of wealth on secret island hideaways.
Each turn, you move your Captain Token around your ship’s action wheel, selecting which action to perform...
It isn't just other pirates standing in your way of burying treasures! The Royal Navy has their eye on you and the more notorious you become, the more eager they are to stopping your exploits. 
An encounter with the Navy will surely slow your progress, so you best be avoiding them. To do so, you're going to need a good ship and a great crew!
There's a lot of scallywags out there looking for adventure! So assembling your crew won't be very hard, but pulling together a winning crew... that's a different story.
Your crew will play a major role in Tiny Epic Pirates. Each crew member brings different advantages to battle and to the actions you'll take. 
The dice listed at the top of each crew card, and your captain's card, represent what number you'll need to roll to score a hit on another ship! Having multiples of a single number can result in lots of damage, but spreading your numbers out can result in more consistent results. The choice is yours!
The icons listed at the bottom of each crew card, and your captain's card, represent bonus actions that can chain together for epic turns! If the first icon matches your chosen action, you'll get to take the action of the second icon for free.
In addition to your crew, you'll have your reputation and your exploits. As you prove yourself in battle, your legend will grow and so will your ability to command your ship.
Winning battles against other pirates, and against notable merchants, will increase your Legend Level. Each new level offers immediate benefits, as well as increases to your ship's movement and the number of dice you roll in battle.
But enough talk, you're no landlubber. You can learn more about Tiny Epic Pirates by engaging with us in the comments, watching the videos below, or by downloading the rulebook below.

Deluxe Content: Crimson Silver Mini Expansion
The Crimson Silver Mini Expansion introduces new Floating Fortresses and Silver as a new resource!
Players are able to visit the Floating Fortresses as they move around the board and perform upgraded versions of Trade, Plunder, and Crew Up. Players may also lay siege to these Fortresses for additional rewards. But beware, the Floating Fortresses have a contract with the Royal Navy and if any Pirates show their dirty face around there, the Navy will be on their tail!
Even with the threat of the Navy though, the precious Silver these markets are known for is simply too alluring to avoid. A lot of blood as been spilled over this Silver. So much that it's known around these seas as Crimson Silver.
***Kickstarter-Limited Exclusivity - Deluxe content will not enter regular distribution. However, it will be available in limited supply at conventions, through contests, online at the BGG promo store, and directly from Gamelyn Games on our website or through our Amazon store.
In Tiny Epic Pirates: Curse of Amdiak, rumors of the unthinkable are spreading quickly around the islands. Rumors of dead pirates returning to the sea... aboard an ominous ghost ship helmed by the legendary pirate Amdiak...
Several new game elements are added to play including cursed gold, a ghost ship that haunts the players as they try to steal the cursed gold, ancient relics, haunted map cards and even skeleton crew!
Players gain cursed gold by stealing it from the ghost ship and attacking other pirates who possess it. Cursed gold can be traded for an ancient relic said to hold ashes of Amdiak. Bury this relic and break the Curse of Amdiak!
If the ghost ship finds catches you though, your captain becomes cursed and you lose your cursed gold. Once cursed you will be able to recruit powerful skeleton crew to mindlessly obey your wicked command!
Do you dare to set sail on ghostly waters?
The Curse of Amdiak expansion will come in a box of the same thickness and quality of Tiny Epic Pirates. It will share the same width and height as well. Making them great for storing side by side!
The Curse of Amdiak expansion is available in the 'All-In Deluxe' reward tier or as an add-on in the pledge manager service after the project.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The publication of a board game is a highly involved process. It can be prone to many mistakes and delays, even for experienced publishers.

We are proud to say that we're prepared for the task at hand and have years of experience in successfully producing board games and fulfilling Kickstarter projects.

Here are the steps we take to prepare and reduce the likelihood of mistakes and delays:

1. We have done significant pre-production. This includes having all the illustrations for the game complete and the graphic art over 95% complete. The production quote is in hand and ready to be initiated.

2. We are working with an experienced manufacturing partner. We are familiar with their production requirements, timelines, payment schedules, communication methods and Chinese freight arrangements and costs for when it comes time for shipping. We will provide tracking information for the boat when the games leave China.

3. We are working with an experienced fulfillment partner. We are confident that they can handle any amount of work we send their way. They have fulfilled many projects and have proven to be communicative, punctual and respectful when dealing with our customers.

Above all, I am 100% dedicated to backer communication. I will be transparent with our process and involve our backers as much as possible. I will be present daily during the project to answer any questions and I read every comment. I will provide regular updates and supply photos of the progress.

Thank you for your trust in us! Let's bring Tiny Epic Pirates to game tables around the world!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our 43rd Kickstarter, and there are some vagaries in terms of timing when it comes to anything produced in China, such as:
Production delays
Shipping delays
Customs delays

The estimated delivery date for this project is May 2021, but keep in mind this is only an estimate. Also, due to the logistics of international shipping, backers in different regions of the world may receive their rewards sooner than others.

We've done our best to minimize this as much as possible, and we are always happy to refund pledges if for some totally unforeseen reason the game can't be delivered at all.

REFUND POLICY

We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. After that, we have a policy of no questions asked, though that’s minus Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we can’t get back from them after 14 days). However, if we’ve begun packaging your pledge for shipment, no refunds are possible. If a component cannot be delivered AT ALL, we refund that completely, including fees.

All refunds after the 14 days close of the campaign may be processed via PayPal or reversed via Stripe to your credit card at our discretion. Refunds within 14 days are reversed via Stripe to your credit card.

This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed.

TERMS AND CONDITIONS

By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that the final look, materials and content of the rewards (and the project) are subject to change and may differ substantially from what is presented while the Kickstarter project was active.

If you do not log in and confirm your pledge within 8 weeks of our notification via email to confirm your pledge, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payment or donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, refund or ship your pledge if you contact us and confirm your pledge after the 8 week window has elapsed. updates.update_content:
Ii-wey, backers!
Hello, Marco Portugal here, Lead Developer of Ankh: Gods of Egypt for another article about the game’s development. Today I’m going to talk about the two expansions: Pantheon and Guardians Set. These expansions add new Gods and Guardians to the game, increasing the available options.

Ii-wey, backers!
We don't have much news to give you today in terms of production. Things keep moving along on the factories and as far we can tell, the schedule as we laid out on previous updates remains unchanged. We'll keep following things and let you know more as soon as we move to a new stage and the further dates become clearer.

Ii-wey, backers!
The factories are back at work in producing Ankh, and things are looking pretty good. The packing slips have been generated and delivered to the factory so they can start planning fulfillment. During the month of March production will continue on all fronts, so that at the start of April they can start working on packing each backer's individual pledge. If everything goes well, shipments will be picked up from mid to late April, and then we enter into the more nebulous zone of when ships get to depart, how long they take to clear customs, and finally get the shipments to the various hubs. Of course, we'll only know more precise dates as some of these hurdles get cleared, but right now it's all still looking like backers should receive their pledges starting in May, and into the next couple months, depending on their location.

campaign.story:
Click here to visit the Blacklist Games Facebook page!
I'm Adam Sadler, senior game designer at Blacklist Games, and I love miniatures. They are what got my brother Brady and me into the hobby back when we were teenagers. Whether we’re using them in roleplaying games, board games, or tabletop miniatures games, we love collecting, assembling, painting, and playing with them. While Blacklist Games has published several of our games that feature miniatures, they saw our passion could be used for the creation of a new division that would focus solely on miniatures and allow for company growth in parallel with creating great board games. With everyone at the company excited about the possibility of this new division, here we are to share it with you!
Blacklist Miniatures will focus entirely on producing high quality, highly detailed, pre-assembled plastic miniatures to be used in any type of game. Blacklist Miniatures: Fantasy Series 1, our first miniatures line, is not only a celebration of our love for miniatures, but also of all things fantasy.
With your support, this campaign will not only bring this project to life, but also open the door to other lines of miniatures in various genres and even new games to utilize them! 
Blacklist Games has published several board games that include detailed plastic miniatures. With each game we publish, we learn more about how to improve the quality of the miniatures we produce. When you compare the miniatures in our first game, Street Masters, with those in our most recent game, Altar Quest, you can see these improvements.
Blacklist Miniatures will take this experience and apply it to produce our best miniatures yet. These miniatures are 28mm scale and will be produced in PVC plastic.
Dragon (Kickstarter Exclusive!)
Male Elf Paladin
Orc
Ooze
QUARTERMASTER LOGISTICS
Blacklist Games, LLC is proud to announce that Quartermaster Logistics (QML) will be handling our fulfillment for Blacklist Miniatures: Fantasy Series 1.
QML has an outstanding reputation for their transparent and stellar customer service, allowing for backers to get freight/shipping updates and personable QA solutions directly from them. From what we’ve seen, they have high standards when it comes to ensuring packages are delivered with enough protection and care to give backers and publishers a peace of mind.
Finding the perfect fit for logistics has been an immense test of trial and error, but after better understanding the needs of backers and our own expectations, we are now confident and excited for this new direction and our partnership with QML for this campaign.
Shipping
Like our previous campaigns, shipping will be collected after this Kickstarter campaign concludes based on the actual costs incurred to ship, via our pledge manager (see the “Terms and Conditions” section below for more details). This is because shipping varies from region to region.
Depending on which region you are in, we will ship from the following hubs: UK (for EU/UK backers), China (for Asia Pacific backers), Canada (for Canadian backers), Australia (for Australia and New Zealand backers) or Indiana (for USA and the rest of the world).
Please note: Altar Quest add-ons (Altar Quest Quest Tier Pledge, Ruins of Arkenspire, First Four) will ship in a separate, earlier wave. See below for details.
SHIPPING FOR FANTASY SERIES 1 ITEMS
The current estimated delivery for Fantasy Series 1 items (Adventurer Tier, Guildmaster Tier, Altar Quest Lurker Pack add-on) is December 2020.
The following is a list of rough estimates for shipping a standard game package (4kg or 8.8lbs volumetric weight).Keep in mind costs may increase based on weight from unlocked stretch goals and/or any optional add-ons purchased.
USA: $10-$15 to most states. $65 to Alaska, Hawaii, and Puerto Rico.
CANADA: $12-$18 to most cities.
LATIN AMERICA: $70-$80 to most countries (see below).
ASIA: $10-$15 to China, Hong Kong, and Singapore. $35 to most other countries.
OCEANIA: $20-$25 to Australia and New Zealand.
AFRICA: $95 to most countries.
EUROPE: $15-$20 to most countries.
$25-$30 to Norway, Switzerland, Finland, Estonia, and Latvia.
$50 to Bosnia/Herzegowina, Croatia, and Iceland.
$65-$70 to Israel, Liechtenstein, and Serbia.
  Unfortunately, because of certain import laws and customs, we currently are NOT ABLE TO SHIP TO Afghanistan, Argentina, Brazil, Kazakhstan, Ukraine, Russia.
If your territory is listed above we hope to be able to offer our product to you later at retail, but are unable to commit to shipping to these territories during the Kickstarter.
SHIPPING FOR ALTAR QUEST ADD-ONS
If you pledge for any of the Altar Quest add-ons (Altar Quest Quest Tier Pledge, First Four Hero Pack, Ruins of Arkenspire) during this campaign, they will be shipped to you separately from your Fantasy Series 1 items. They will be shipped in the same time period as rewards are shipped to backers of the Altar Quest campaign (current estimate is July 2020).
You will pay for this shipment based on the shipping rates from the Altar Quest Kickstarter campaign. In other words, you will pay the same shipping costs that Altar Quest backers paid for these items to be shipped.
Terms and Conditions
By pledging to this project, you acknowledge that you have read and accepted the following terms and conditions.
FINAL PRODUCT
The products/rewards shown on this Kickstarter page are subject to change. The final products/rewards you receive could differ from what is presented here.
PROJECT UPDATES
It is your responsibility as a backer of this project to read project updates in order to stay up to date with important details and requests from the Blacklist Games team.
COMMUNICATING WITH BLACKLIST GAMES POST-CAMPAIGN
Please note that we do not monitor the Kickstarter messaging inbox outside of a live Kickstarter campaign. Therefore, after this project has ended, please ensure to send all communications to customerservice@blacklistgamesllc.com
REFUND POLICY
Full refunds are available within 14 days of the campaign’s end date. All refunds taking place within 14 days of the close of the campaign are reversed in full via Stripe to your credit card.
Afterwards, refunds minus the Kickstarter and payment processing fees (which we cannot recuperate) will be available before and during the first 30 days the pledge manager is open. Once these initial 30 days have passed, no refunds will be possible. A reminder of the refund cutoff date will be announced in project updates.
This project is being funded in USD and any refunds processed will be in USD for the exact amount received in USD, excluding any applicable fees depending on the time of the refund being processed as previously stated.
COMPLETING THE PLEDGE MANAGER
In the weeks following the conclusion of the campaign, an email invitation to our pledge manager will be sent to all backers to allow them entry to the pledge manager; further details on this process will be provided in a project update published around the same time the email invites are sent out.
Backers must confirm their “order” (pledge rewards + purchased add-ons) in our pledge manager before its closing date in order to receive their order. “Confirming your order” means entering your valid shipping information and paying any balances due for shipping costs and selected add-ons in the pledge manager.
If you confirm your order by the closing date of the pledge manager, you agree that our responsibility to you is to ship your confirmed order as entered into the pledge manager. That title and risk passes to you upon delivery to a common carrier for such shipment, and you are responsible for import duties or any other duties that may be payable to the relevant tax authorities, providing correct address information and ensuring this address is deliverable by normal methods.
If you do not confirm your order before the closing date of the pledge manager, you agree that we have fulfilled our obligations to you in full for payments/donations received. However, we may, at our discretion, agree to place you on a waiting list for backers with unconfirmed orders if you contact us after the closing date of the pledge manager but before fulfillment of rewards begins. Backers on this list will be contacted once initial fulfillment to backers has concluded in order to offer them a final chance to complete their orders; note that this process would not involve the pledge manager and that any shipments sent as a result of this process would not benefit from any “friendly shipping” rates offered during the Kickstarter campaign and would undoubtedly be shipped at a higher cost due to not benefitting from overall Kickstarter shipping rates. 
Remember that unconfirmed pledges make it difficult for us to plan production and logistics, and could lead to project delays. For this project we do not intend to allow this to happen, therefore if you do not complete your order by the pledge manager’s closing date, we cannot guarantee the availability of add-ons/exclusive items in sufficient quantity for your pledge.

Following five successful Kickstarter campaigns, we are continuing to learn how to further improve our marketing, design, manufacturing, fulfillment, and distribution, as well as how best to nurture our growing community.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
When you pledge on Kickstarter you put your trust in a project long before it is completed and you contribute, with this trust, to the making of Pax Renaissance 2nd ed, Pax Viking and High Frontier 4 All: Module 3 – Conflict a reality. We are grateful for the trust you show us.

Another factor that is influencing the world right now is the covid-19 outbreak, which is constantly evolving and continues to escalate globally. At the moment Ion Game Design continues as usual here in Sweden and we are in contact with our partners to be able to give all our backers continues updates. campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
Canvas will be printed on high quality, durable components. The sleeves that come with the game are not only essential for gameplay, they also help increase the lifespan of the cards. Canvas was designed with future add-ons and expansions in mind. The art style and graphic design can handle different illustration and themes so that we can create future expansions that don't require reprinting all of the base game components.
Reusability and recyclability
Our manufacturer, PandaGM, will be producing replacement components so that damaged or missing pieces can be replaced with a small shipment instead of a second copy of the game, saving gas and materials. Canvas components are stored in reusable storage bags. The box efficiently holds all game pieces and add-ons without wasted space from a plastic insert.
Sustainable materials
The box and punchboard are made from 30% recycled materials for the ideal blend of durability and sustainability. The cards are made with materials from FSC certified sources. Components are printed with eco-friendly water-based ink and varnish. Our premium components are made from wood instead of plastic. The packing cartons are 100% recycled paper pulp.
Environmentally friendly factories
PandaGM recycles all plastic and paper waste. The factory is fully air-conditioned for worker comfort and has passed ISO worker health and safety standards, is BSCI social compliance certified, and follows the OHSAS requirements for occupational health and safety. Their project management and customer service teams all work remotely, which has a major impact on their carbon footprint.

Canvas: Reflections is LIVE on Kickstarter
Hello again! We hope you've all been enjoying Canvas. If you'd like to join us on another Kickstarter adventure, head on over to the recently launched Canvas: Reflections page. The campaign funded in just 24 minutes and already over 6,000 backers have joined in!

Campaign Wrap-Up
With UK shipping underway, fulfillment is nearing the end! 52,145 rewards have now been shipped to backers all over the world. We owe a big thank you to our manufacturer, Panda Games Manufacturing, and our distributors Funagain, Surfin' Meeple, Aetherworks, and Zatu for overcoming challenges brought on by COVID and Brexit and bringing this project across the finish line. And thanks to all you backers for going on this journey with us. Your support and generosity are what allows Andrew and I to keep our dream jobs, and we are forever grateful for that.

We have some great news for UK backers!
We just received word that the freight shipment arrived today in the UK and will be at Zatu Fulfillment's warehouse on Monday. There are several projects in queue with this shipment, but they are going to ship Canvas first! Zatu will get to work picking, packing, and mailing out nearly 5,000 rewards. All orders are expected to be shipped out by the end of next week. Jeff and I want to thank everyone again for their patience as we, the freight forwarders, fulfillment team, and Zatu navigated this post-Brexit process.

Just a quick update for our UK backers:
Surfin Meeple just confirmed that the mountain of paperwork has been completed by both the fulfillment center and the UK customs office. The pick-up request has been submitted and the fulfillment center is just waiting on the go ahead from the UK customs office to ship everything to Zatu this week. Andrew and I know this UK delivery process has been frustratingly slow as the involved parties are still figuring out how to navigate through all this new legislation. We'll keep pushing for updates from the fulfillment center and post the next UK shipping update the moment we receive news. Hopefully we'll get a freight shipment and delivery timeline in the coming weeks.

Fulfillment Progress
EU: The EU fulfillment center has at least one more week of shipping games out the door. So, if you still don't have your tracking information or if you have not received your order, please allow at least another couple weeks while the games are in transit.

Andrew and I are so happy to see that many of you have received your copies of Canvas! It's so cool to see all the community engagement, from the interpretive painting analyses on Instagram, to the solo challenges on Board Game Geek. One of my favorite posts was by @tabletoptale featuring an alternate setup using the easels to display the Scoring Cards, which I've recreated below in case anyone wants to try it.

It's happening! The fulfillment centers are working as fast as they can to pick, pack, and label your orders. Be aware that not everyone will receive their orders at the same time due to COVID safety precautions in place and over 50,000 rewards needing to be packed & shipped. We appreciate your patience as the fulfillment process is ongoing.
Shipping Timelines

Last Minute Address Changes
Wednesday, January 6th is the last possible day to change your shipping address. If you need to update it, email your new address to help@funagainlogistics.com.
Freight Shipping Update

Hello backers! We have some news to share about shipping.
But first, just a reminder that the below timelines are still estimations. We could wait until we receive firm dates, but then backers would feel left in the dark for a long period of time. campaign.story:
Hi, we're board game designers James Ernest and Mike Selinker. In 2010, we published Lords of Vegas, a high energy casino-building game. It cemented itself as one of the best games we've ever made, and a favorite of such series as Tabletop, Shut Up & Sit Down, and The Dice Tower. Our 2014 hard-to-find expansion Up! enabled more strategic casino-building and added pieces for more players. But since then, we haven't been able to bring anything new to the game's legions of fans.
Until today, that is. Last month, we regained the rights to Lords of Vegas. After five years in the hopper, we're publishing the long-awaited expansion Underworld, filled with mobsters and shady dealers. We're bringing out a 10th Anniversary Boss Bundle, a lush mobster briefcase stocked with poker chips, a felt-lined tray, player piece upgrades, and gambling dice. We're making a 15th anniversary edition of our book Dealer's Choice: The Complete Handbook of Saturday Night Poker. And you can get the previously released versions of the base set and Up! here. We want to reward our fans for supporting our game all these years.
If you've never heard of the game, you might want to know... 
The base set, Up!, and a theory of what the Underworld box might look like.

Lords of Vegas is a city-building eurogame in which players are casino moguls turning the desert of Nevada into something even nastier. The game starts in 1940, when Las Vegas is merely cheap motels and one-room poker houses. Of course, you bulldoze them. Over the next few decades, you construct glittering meccas of gambling and debauchery. You can build, remodel, reorganize, and sprawl your casinos along the Strip. Should you come up a few million short in your plans for world domination, take those dollars to a competitor's casino and roll the dice on a gambling spree. Here's what it looks like in play.
The game comes with a beautiful board of the Vegas Strip, illustrated by the masterful Franz Vohwinkel. It has 48 casino tiles, 55 cards, 40 player markers, and loads of paper money—and, oh yeah, 48 dice. Yes, we made a eurogame with 48 dice. 
Here's Mike to explain how it works.
And here's Quinns of Shut Up & Sit Down walking you through it.
With the strongly recommended expansion Up!, your casinos build skyward, gaining you  more wealth and power. This expands the game to 2-6 players using the base set and Up! The expansion has 48 riser tiles for elevating your casinos, 20 player markers, even more money, and 24 more dice, bringing the total to a spine-rattling 72 dice. If you have a copy of the base set but have never gotten your hands on Up!, please take this opportunity to do so. You'll never play the game the same way again.  
The Underworld expansion is a brand new set of characters, events, and properties to enhance your game with that seedy-side-of-Vegas feeling. See below for that. 
Here are some nice people saying nice things about Lords of Vegas:
"Lords of Vegas is the perfect simulation of the reality of gambling in Vegas, only sometimes you win."—Wil Wheaton, Tabletop 
"Lords of Vegas is the economic warfare game that we find ourselves recommending the most. The reason that no one should play Monopoly. Ever."—Shut Up & Sit Down 
"I have not seen this level of intensity. It goes back and forth fighting over these (casinos). One of the best games of the year."—Tom Vasel, The Dice Tower (both Vasel's and Eric Summerer's top 10 of 2010)  
"Buy the game. Now. Do it! I'm the Lord of Vegas."—Storm of Paul & Storm, alongside the luminaries Matt Lees, Emma Larkins, Peter Adkison, Matt Forbeck,  Aubrey Cello, Patrick Hillier, and Ignacy Trzewiczek
Cover design for the Underworld box, illustrated by Fastner & Larson.

Underworld is the Lords of Vegas expansion we've been wanting to make for a decade. Ever since the game came out, people have said, "This is great, but where's the seedy underbelly of Vegas?" We've got it for you in Underworld. Faster than you can say "Those are Terry Benedict's casinos!" you'll be deep in the muck with mobsters, thieves, grifters, and, worst of all, accountants. Here's Mike with the lowdown.
This expansion comes with a new Underworld board by Franz. It depicts downtown Las Vegas, the current site of the Fremont Street Experience, north of the main board's Vegas Strip. This is a work in progress. 
Underworld board by Franz Vohwinkel. Image not final.
Underworld contains 52 cards, all lovingly illustrated by the talented Nate Taylor. Here's how they work. At the start of every turn, you flip out a new Underworld card onto the Underworld board. You then gain a new action called Acquire, which allows you to spend money to buy a single Underworld card. Some give you points in different ways, while others give you money over time. Others provide powers that you can use to alter your gameplay. One card might make sprawling easier, while another gives you more opportunities to gamble every turn. Eventually, who and what you have in your Underworld cards can drastically change your board position by the game's end.
Playtest versions shown. Images not final.
Right now, if you own Lords of Vegas, you can help us perfect this expansion. We've created a print and play with rules and cards, which you can download by going to this page and clicking on the button marked Lords of Vegas Underworld Print and Play. Once you've played with it, go to our feedback form and tell us what you think!
Each copy of Underworld comes with two promo cards: Time Share and The Big Score. (See below for how to get our charity promo card, Vegas Shutdown.)
Underworld is the expansion we've wanted to make for over half a decade. With your help, we can finally introduce the mob to Lords of Vegas.
The Boss Bundle is inside your very own mobster briefcase. Image not final.
For diehard Lords of Vegas fans, the 10th Anniversary Boss Bundle is the option you want. It's a mobster briefcase box with places to hold the components from the base game, Up!, and Underworld. Check it out. 
Prototype of the Boss Bundle briefcase box. Image not final.

When you pull this game off your shelf, we want you to feel like a casino magnate. The briefcase box is 320 mm x 320 mm (fits nicely into a Kallax shelf) but feels weighty and substantial. There's a leather-like exterior, a felt interior, and a removable felt-lined tray with snug spaces for each player's components. It's the box we always wanted Lords of Vegas to be in.
Prototype of the Boss Bundle briefcase box interior, with the felt-lined tray pulled out. Image not final.
The tray is dark wood with a felt-lined interior. There are separate compartments for the casino tiles, Up! risers, property and Underworld cards, and poker chips. The scoring markers, dice, and parking lot markers fit into the recess between the tray and the briefcase wall. The rulebook, base set board, and Underworld board set into the top.
Prototype of the poker chips. Image and quantities of each denomination are not final.
Fans have asked for poker chips for years. The Boss Bundle'spoker chipsare still in design, but these are some initial concepts. We plan to include 20 each of $1 million, $2 million, $5 million, $10 million, and $25 million chips. The chips we like are high-density plastic with a metal chip inside making them 11.5 grams similar to a clay chip, but more durable. (Poker chips are also available as an add-on for $55 a set.)
Prototypes and designs for the bags, gambling dice, player pawns, and cars in the player upgrade kit. Nothing here is final.
The Boss Bundle also comes with a player upgrade kit. We'll include 60 wooden cars (of a different shape for each player) to use in place of the markers for parking lots. We are including a deluxe version of the scoring tokens, possibly airplanes so you can vroom around on the scoring track like it's a runway at McCarran Airport. The player pack will come with six velvet drawstring bags, one for each player. It will also contain a pair of larger casino gambling dice. (The player upgrade kit is also available as an add-on for $45 a set.)
Digital prototype of the Vegas Playmat. Image not final.
The Boss Bundle will also come with a Vegas playmat. This is a 24x28" neoprene playmat which features both the base set board (The Strip) and the Underworld board (Downtown Vegas). The playmat comes with the Boss Bundle, but is too big to fit in the briefcase box. (The Vegas playmat is also available as an add-on for $40.)
Since all people who get the Boss Bundle should have all three boxes, we've added to the bundle a unified rulebook that incorporates the rules of base, Up!, and Underworld.  (The unified rulebook is also available as an add-on for $5.)
The 10th Anniversary Boss Bundle comes with a copy of the base set, Up!, Underworld, and Dealer's Choice. Or, if you already own the base set and Up!, you can get it without those at the Boss Bundle (New Stuff Only) level. You can also buy most of these items as add-ons. See below for details on how that works.
If you want something really unique, check The Big Score Bundle with You In It. That gets you illustrated into one of our promo cards like The Big Score. You or someone you really like will become a Lords of Vegas denizen forever. We'll send you 10 of your promo card so you can leave your calling card when you next rob the Strip blind. 
The Dealer's Choice cover from 2005. Phil's drawing a new one for the 15th anniversary edition.
In 2005, we joined with our buddy Phil Foglio, whom you might know from the Hugo Award-winning graphic novel series Girl Genius, to write and illustrate the definitive book on dealer's choice poker. We called it Dealer's Choice: The Complete Handbook of Saturday Night Poker. After it went out of print, we were often begged for copies. So we decided to get the rights to that book back too. We're excited to offer a brand new 15th anniversary edition of Dealer's Choice, complete with a new cover. This new edition will be a staple at every poker night you attend.
The Dealer's Choice softcover contains the rules to 200 poker games, including old favorites like Omaha and Chicago, and bizarre new constructions like Demolition Man, Black Jack Shellacque, Frankenstein, and Night Baseball of the Living Dead. Plus we've added a bunch of additional games courtesy of our columns in Bluff Magazine. The book also features valuable tips for how to host a poker night, how to design your own games, and how to talk like a poker player. Every copy of the book comes with a PDF and an ebook. It's cool. 
 Here's a handy table of what's included in each reward level.   
We also have a $1 level for those who just want access to our PledgeManager after the campaign. We know times are tough, so if you are stressing right now about finances, you can just pledge a dollar and we'll let you upgrade later. 
You can also buy many of the elements of the Boss Bundle as add-ons, using the prices in this chart.

Each backer who receives physical goods will pay the actual cost of shipping their rewards. Final shipping rates and costs will be loaded into our PledgeManager, and you will pay for your shipping via the PledgeManager as well.  We'll charge backers as close to our actual shipping costs for their shipping address as we can for each order. Lone Shark is not making any profit on shipping and handling. Including add-ons in your order will increase shipping costs. See below for our current shipping estimates, based on shipping out of our fulfillment sites of Florida, England, and Australia. (And yes, those "Rest of World" numbers are horrible. If you're from those places, we're really sorry about that,) 
Again, these are estimates. You'll be charged exactly what it costs us to get it to your location, wherever that is. 
We are game designers. James founded Cheapass Games and the head crustacean at Crab Fragment Labs. His games include Kill Doctor Lucky, Tak: A Beautiful Game, Button Men, Pairs, and Unexploded Cow. Mike is the lead developer and/or designer of Betrayal at House on the Hill, the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game, Apocrypha, The Ninth World, Risk Godstorm, and Thornwatch, as well as the author of The Maze of Games, The Kobold Guide to Board Game Design, and Puzzlecraft. Mike and James co-founded Lone Shark Games, and together designed Pirates of the Spanish Main, Unspeakable Words, Fightball, Gloria Mundi, 12 Days, and many other games, and recently collaborated together with the Brothers Chaps on Trogdor!! The Board Game.
Lone Shark Games is a Seattle board game and puzzle company that has made such Kickstarter-fueled games and books as The Maze of Games, Apocrypha, The Ninth World, Thornwatch, and Puzzlecraft. We also are responsible for the design of Betrayal at House on the Hill: Widow's Walk and the Pathfinder Adventure Card Game. You can get all our stuff at our webstore.
We're joined by some great artists on Lords of Vegas. Franz Vohwinkel does our boards; he's known for his work on Magic: The Gathering, Dungeons & Dragons, Dominion, and boardgames like Ra and Princes of Florence. Steve Fastner and Rich Larson did the covers for our base set and Up!, and are famous for their comic and pinup art. Nate Taylor is illustrating the Underworld cards; you may know him from his collaborations with Pat Rothfuss, especially The Princess and Mr. Whiffle. 
This is a strange time to be asking for money for a game. Here's some things we know.
1. It's the 10th anniversary of this game, and that only comes around once.
2. We don't know when things will get better. The economy could rev back up quickly, or things could get worse. We just can't know.
3. We can't print the game without help.
So, encouraged by lots of fans on BoardGameGeek, we decided to go ahead with the campaign. Still, most of our opportunities to promote the campaign—conventions, magazines, Twitch play around a table—are not available to us right now. We could use your help. Please share this post as much as you can with people who like games. You can also put this badge on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or Kickstarter icon.
We also want to give back to the Las Vegas community, which was open when we shot our videos. So we're making a promo card called Vegas Shutdown (named in honor of our other favorite Vegas board game, Henry Stern's Vegas Showdown). Since it's a charity thing, and Kickstarter doesn't do charity campaigns, you can't buy it here. But if you pledge for a physical reward in this campaign, you'll have the first opportunity to get copies of the promo card for an additional $5 each in our PledgeManager. Every charity promo card purchased will help Three Square Food Bank take care of workers affected by the shutdown of the casino industry. Here's the card.
That's our reasons for doing this now. Once you're done taking care of your needs for yourself, your family, and your community, if you decide you like the game and would like to contribute, we'd really appreciate it. Thanks, and we hope to see you playing Lords of Vegas around a game table soon.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Needless to say, we're concerned about the coronavirus pandemic's effect on the production and shipping of this campaign. 

We're acquiring inventory of the last printing of the base set and Up! from Asmodee. We're making new editions of Underworld and Dealer's Choice for this project, and we don't anticipate any manufacturing problems with those. Underworld is being printed by the same printer who printed the base set and Up! They're in the United States, which costs more but avoids problems with tariffs and shipping from China. We expect that our factory and warehouses will be open by the time these need to go to those steps, but of course we cannot know for sure. We are committed to getting the games to our backers whatever difficulties arise in the next few months.

The 10th Anniversary boss boxes are considerably more complex. We've set the shipping date on those for Christmas, but our experience with these types of projects on Thornwatch, Tak, and Apocrypha leads us to be careful about specific dates, given some instability in the supply channel now. We are planning to ship these editions separately from the games themselves, so if you pledge for a Boss Bundle, you'll get your games and books at the same time everyone else does. We'll keep you in the know as the Boss Bundle is developed. Thanks in advance.

If you have reached this point and are still unsure about backing Moonshine Empire, please allow us to tell you a bit about ourselves, how we made this game, and where we hope to go from here.

Over the last two years of development, we've extensively playtested Moonshine Empire both with friends and family, and then at local breweries, game stores, and events. We sent out copies of the game to multiple independent game reviewers and blind playtesters. The end result is a fantastic theme with unique mechanics and a very well balanced medium weight game we are sure you'll love.

For production, we have several competitive quotes, so we know our project is financially feasible. Since this is the first game we have had manufactured, we (of course) did it the hard way... and fully created the game (cards, board, box, components, tiles...everything), so we are confident in the game that we have created and have added time to our schedule to accommodate any unseen delays.

This is our tenth Kickstarter, so we know what we are doing. However, with current events and the world's landscape changing almost daily, its hard for us to know exactly how or if COVID-19 will affect this campaign. If there were a relapse in China, or in the US for that matter, we could see production or fulfillment slowdowns. 

However, we have a great reputation for industry-best communication and transparency with our backers. We are also a very healthy company and have plenty of staying power even if we saw many more tough months ahead. We'll be here.
