campaign.story:
It’s hard to believe that SPACE INVADERS entered the world’s arcades in June 1978 and turned forty in 2018! During this time, the game and its brand have become part of modern culture. Its characters have become design icons in their own right and have permeated not only the world of video games, but also the worlds of art and fashion. As long time fans of tabletop games and electronic games alike, we were astounded that, during all this time, nobody had yet developed a genuine SPACE INVADERS board game. We plan to change this now with your help: We are incredibly excited to announce our crowdfunding campaign for...
PLAY

 Source: taitochannel; https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lu_DDfmUFK4
The Game
Our primary goal is to create a fantastic board game experience while remaining true to the original game’s visual presentation and atmosphere. SPACE INVADERS - THE BOARD GAME is a combination of a deck-building card game with a measured dose of board game strategy mixed in.
In SPACE INVADERS - THE BOARD GAME, 2-4 players defend their moon base against the SPACE INVADERS by moving their cannons across the game board in order to gather intelligence about the enemy above them. Destroying SPACE INVADERS provides powerful cards that are then added to the players' hands. Gathered intel may be used for targeted research to further enhance the player deck capabilities. The game is driven by a total of 242 Action Cards, energy cards and researchable technologies.
While the invaders are the shared enemy, SPACE INVADERS - THE BOARD GAME is a competitive game of survival. Like in the original arcade game, each player ultimately fights for their own HI-SCORE.  
40th Anniversary Emblem
We are equally excited that TAITO is allowing us to create some of the last products to use the exclusive SPACE INVADERS 40th Anniversary Emblem, which all backer rewards available during this campaign will carry.
40th Anniversary Editions: Only on Kickstarter!
INSTANTLY COLLECTABLE!
After June 15th of this year, we will no longer be able to continue to offer these unique game editions anywhere. We think that SPACE INVADERS - THE BOARD GAME will not only entertain you as the great game we feel it is, but the game and our other exclusive backer rewards are sure to become instant collector's items.
Stretch Goals & More!
 The final rulebook PDFs will be available for download in 6 languages shortly after the campaign ends.
A digital do-it-yourself version of the game will be available to all backers for download shortly after the campaign ends to shorten the time until the production units arrive. This is an evolution of the materials we used to produce our own prototypes (see below) incl. templates to make your own SPACE INVADERS style game pieces.
4 carefully balanced additional Invader cards are added to the mid-game.
The 3D lenticular lens panel has a self adhesive back and is the same size as the presentation box - you can use it as an alternate cover, stick on your wall or use it any other way you please! Real 3D effect - no glasses required.
We will reveal additional stretch goals and further information as the campaign progresses - please check back in frequently!
How Does It PLAY?
Before the game begins, all 5 rows of SPACE INVADERS cards are shuffled individually and then placed face down onto the game board, hiding salvageable technology that is later unveiled during gameplay to continually improves the players' card decks. 
Bunker elements are placed onto the bunker locations and "Extra Life" tokens are handed to the players. The number of tokens and bunker elements is determined by the number of participating players to ensure a balanced experience.
Players start with an identical deck of cards and draw a starting hand of 5 random cards that provides them with energy and actions. As the game progresses, each player tries to improve their deck in order to increase the number and the power of their available actions, a higher energy output, and ultimately a higher SCORE. When one of the GAME OVER conditions is met - for example, if a player manages to shoot the UFO - the player with the HI-SCORE wins.
The game is structured in turns and each player's turn consists of four phases:
I. Research
II. Action
III. Energy Transform
IV. Cleanup
Phase I - Research
The first research phase starts with an optional scan of the area above the player's cannon. Scans defuse booby traps hidden by some Invaders - but only for the scanning player, and only during the current turn! Scans also award the player with "Alien Intel" tokens that may be used to research new technologies during the research phase.
Phase II - Action
During the action phase, the active player plays one or more Action Cards from their current hand. Action Cards may allow the player to play and draw additional cards, boost their energy output and gain more transforms - as well as scans and movement for their cannons or the UFO. Action Cards also have many other unique abilities that allow the players to manipulate their own or other players' hands and card decks.
Example Action Card collected by destroying Invaders
Phase III - Transform
During the transform phase, the active player can transform their current energy output (usually once unless additional transforms were gained during Phase II) in order to either shoot the SPACE INVADERS above their cannon position, or invest in one of the available additional Action Cards or Energy Resources that get added to their decks for use in one of their following turns. The remains of destroyed SPACE INVADERS also provide new technologies and get added to the player’s deck. Shooting at SPACE INVADERS also attracts enemy fire from the SPACE INVADER columns to the left and right of the firing player - potentially causing damage to Bunkers or other players.
Phase IV - Cleanup
During the cleanup phase, any cards remaining in the player's hand are placed on top of their discard pile and five new cards are drawn from their draw pile (if necessary, the discard pile gets shuffled to become the new draw pile). Finally, the current player signals the end of the turn by moving the UFO one slot to the right.
Scoring
All of the cards and tokens the players hold at the end of the game carry a score value. The player who has the highest total score wins the game. 
Low level cards may have a zero score
Strategy
In SPACE INVADERS - THE BOARD GAME, the players’ cannon position on the game board affects the cards and corresponding upgrades that are available.  Not all card types are available at all times. To win, it is important to use a mix of scanning, research, and enemy attacks to acquire the components to build a winning deck.
Certain resources are always available
You can find a full play-session (about one hour) on YouTube: https://youtu.be/LjXbd-uEX5Q
Please note that this was recorded during a play-testing session with a prototype - it does not reflect the quality of the final editions and there might be minor rule differences compared to the production version. 
You can download a preview of the rules here (English only): https://spaceinvadersbg.com/img/SpaceInvadersRules2.61.pdf
Please note that this is not the final rulebook layout, which we will make available as soon as possible after the campaign ends.
CAMPAIGN BENEFITS!
While we plan to release SPACE INVADERS - THE BOARD GAME to retail sometime during 2020, the rewards available during this campaign are unique and will not be available again after this campaign ends. The suggested retail price of the game is planned to be somewhere around $40 USD and will include content comparable to the standard edition. Compared to the retail release, these are your benefits, if you back this campaign:
Much faster access to the game
Around 25% savings compared to retail release for standard edition
40th Anniversary emblem only available to Kickstarter backers
Deluxe Edition only available to Kickstarter backers
Backer Rewards!
SPACE INVADERS - THE BOARD GAME - Standard Edition
What do you get with the Standard Game?
• 2-piece Game Box
• Game Board
• 55 Invader Cards, sorted into 5 ranks of 11 cards each
• 60 Researched Technology cards, sorted into 12 technologies of 5 cards each
• Punchboards for 40 Bunker slices and 64 Game Tokens
• 4 Cannons, painted wood
• 1 UFO, painted wood
• 127 Resource and Start cards sorted into 50 Dilithium, 30 Thorium, 20 Antimatter, 12 Time Warp and 12 Tractor Thrust cards
• Card Sorting Tray / Inlay
• Manual
• All unlocked standard edition stretch goals 
SPACE INVADERS - THE BOARD GAME - Deluxe Edition
What do you get with the Deluxe Edition?
• Magnetic Game Box, INDIVIDUALLY NUMBERED and SPOT UV COATED
• Rubber Play Mat (Neoprene), ROLLABLE
• 55 Invader Cards on PREMIUM CARDSTOCK, sorted into 5 ranks of 11 cards each
• 60 Researched Technology cards on PREMIUM CARDSTOCK, sorted into 12 technologies of 5 cards each
• 40 Bunker slices, ABS
• 32 Alien Intel tokens, SILK SCREENED ABS
• 32 Extra Life tokens, SILK SCREENED ABS
• 1 UFO, LASERCUT ACRYLIC
• 4 Cannons, LASERCUT ACRYLIC
Deluxe Edition only: Cannons and UFO made from fluorescent, lasercut acrylic.
• 127 Resource and Start cards on PREMIUM CARDSTOCK, sorted into 50 Dilithium, 30 Thorium, 20 Antimatter, 12 Time Warp and 12 Tractor Thrust cards
• Card Sorting Tray / Inlay 
• Manual
• All unlocked deluxe edition stretch goals
Not shown: Manual, Sorting Tray (w/Inlay)
DIGITAL PRINT'N PLAY EDITION
Access to the PRINT'N PLAY EDITION is included in all pledge levels. We will send you all the info to make your own copy of the game at home, shortly after the campaign ends.
DIY prototype of the game using off-the-shelf game pieces and tokens
SPACE INVADERS DIORAMA
For the art enthusiasts and serious collectors among you, backers of the campaign will also have the opportunity to select, as their reward, a very exclusive, strictly limited, hand assembled diorama that commemorates the game; The diorama will additionally carry an individual serial number plaque and a printed autograph of SPACE INVADERS creator, Tomohiro Nishikado.  Each Diorama includes the Deluxe Edition of SPACE INVADERS - THE BOARD GAME.


Mr. Nishikado Signing for the Diorama Reward

Shipping
We will be charging shipping after the Kickstarter campaign concludes based on the actual costs incurred to ship from our fulfillment partner's closest distribution center to your delivery address. You will pay for shipping & handling in our Pledge Manager. Links to the Pledge Manager will be sent shortly after the Kickstarter campaign ends. Shipping costs vary widely based on where you will receive your reward, and the exact reward chosen. The weight of the game may also increase based on unlocked stretch goals.
Shipping of the game is US, EU, Canada, China, and Australia friendly.
The Diorama is handmade in the USA and will be shipped from there. It is quite large and heavy (approx. 25lbs), resulting in relatively high shipping fees.

A brief history of SPACE INVADERS
Created by Tomohiro Nishikado, the original arcade game was released in 1978.  
Tomohiro Nishikado
SPACE INVADERS was manufactured and sold by TAITO in Japan and licensed to Midway in the US. It is one of the earliest examples of a shooting game.
For the game mechanism, Designer Nishikado drew inspiration from the earlier game Breakout. To complete it, Nishikado designed the game characters and programmed everything by himself, using development tools that he created from scratch. Today the game is considered to have been a key factor in driving the games business from a novelty to a global industry.
The game has been the inspiration for many other video games, re-released on numerous platforms, and led to several sequels. The Atari 2600 version, released in 1980, is widely believed to have quadrupled the system's sales and is remembered as the first ever ‘killer app’ for a videogame console.
SPACE INVADERS has been referenced and parodied in multiple television shows and movies, and has even been added to MoMA‘s Architecture and Design collection. The CRAB  invader has become a pop culture icon, often representing the video game industry as a whole.
Why do you need to raise funds, isn't SPACE INVADERS big enough to be made without this campaign?
While SPACE INVADERS is a popular brand, we have licensed it from the creators at TAITO. We are lucky that TAITO supports the creation of the game, but we ourselves are just a small company and do not have the means to produce the game or any of the other rewards in relevant numbers without raising capital through this campaign.

*If you already own the base game, you can get all the new stretch goals and the 5-6 player expansion for $1 + $1 shipping pledging in the Starving Artist tier!
There's no question: the life of a paint-by-cube artist is hard. What little money you do earn is invested right back into paint and canvases. Without that paint and those canvases, you won't be able to follow your dream of becoming a famous artist. Being a starving artist is a constant struggle.    
Starving Artists is an award-winning, blind-drafting and resource management game for one to four players.  Using some of the world's most beautiful works of art, players complete these masterpieces using transparent cubes in an attempt to become famous artists. It takes about 40-60 minutes. 
The original copies are all gone! We wanted to bring it back to Kickstarter with more goodies! The new exclusive Kickstarter expansion provides additional components that enable you to play up to six players!  
Starving Artists is played over a series of turns. Each turn represents a new day. On each day, you must choose between: buying new canvases, painting the canvases you already own, or working in order to get more paint. If at the end of the day, you've completed a masterpiece, you can sell it to earn more paint and food. If you don't spend your days efficiently, you won't be able to feed yourself, and you'll have to give up on your dreams. 
You can read the current version of the rules or scroll to the end to see a short how to play at the bottom of this page.
As an aspiring paint-by-cube artist, your life centers around the paintings you must complete.
In order to complete those paintings, you take two actions each day. You can buy new canvases from the market, paint canvases in your studio using your paint cubes, or work to collect new paint cubes.  
At the end of each day, you can sell your completed paintings. But, you'll be competing in the limited marketplace for paintings with anyone else who wants to sell. If there's not enough paint to go around, you'll have to make do with less. 
Each copy of Starving Artists comes with everything that an aspiring artist needs: paints, studios, canvases and food. They also come with things that you probably wouldn't think about: telescoping box, rule book, paint bag, and a wooden carrot (to mark the first player).

Both Zafty Games and Fairway 3 Games have proven track record to produce complete projects. Starving Artists is a complete product proven in its original print run. 

This Kickstarter features a new expansion, and will help fund the next print run of the game. We're 100% confident we'll be delivering the rewards of this campaign on time or early.

Copyrights and the Public Domain 
Starving Artists is using only images that have fallen into the public domain and are thus no longer protected by copyright. The paintings are in the public domain because either they were "published" before 1922 or it has been more than 70 years since the artist's death (which was probably not due to starvation). For more information about the duration of copyrights, please refer to this wonderfully, helpful chart produced by Cornell: http://copyright.cornell.edu/resources/publicdomain.cfm

If you believe that any of the paintings are not in the public domain (whether in the United States or elsewhere), please feel free to contact us at support@zaftygames.com

Hey, Starving Artists backers. It’s Mike.
For those who haven't gotten their game, this is a significant and important update.
Slightly more than a year ago, I licensed the rights to do a reprint and expansions for Starving Artists to Zafty Games and, like all such contracts, giving them full control of basically everything for that reprint. Glenn Drover was the founder and president of Eagle Games, Inc. from 2000 – 2006. ART
Annie Stegg Gerard has a special love for the 18th century Rococo painters who have had a large influence on her own method. She finds inspiration in their imagination, and the dreamlike palette and lively brushwork that combine to create a wonderful atmosphere of enchantment. She believes that they sought to transport us to different worlds and fantastic places though their works. In her own work, known for its beautiful, enigmatic figures and lively creatures, Annie strives to depict this same transportive effect to the viewer. She and her husband live in Northern Georgia with their twin boys, dog, and two cats.

18Chesapeake is a beginner game in the 18xx genre. It allows players to gradually build up skills that they can apply to other more complex 18xx games.  
 The "vintage" alternate art will appear on the reverse side of the board from the basic art--same game, just in a new style.
Revenue track in the same style as the new board! 
Excellent introductory 18xx game and tool for teaching new players 18xx
Simple core 18xx rules
2-6 players (yes, 2-player 18xx!)
Quick play time (2.5-3.5 hours, a “weeknight” game)
Eurogame-style components with clear, easy to understand graphic design
Game components
1 map board with stock market, initial offering, and bank pool (2mm, standard thickness)
Cards: 6 private companies
Cards: 72 public company share certificates
Cards: 31 train cards
Cards: 1 priority deal card
Cards: 6 player order cards (numbered 1-6)
95 tiles (1.5mm thick cardboard)
8 public company charters (card, possible stretch goal to cardboard to match tile thickness)
47 wooden tokens and one wooden round marker (with stickers)
1 revenue track
Packet of paper money to use as a bank (or use your own poker chips as many 18xx players do)
Rule booklet with illustrated examples
STRETCH GOALS
    Double-sided board!
    Blue Crab first player marker!
    Premium wood station marker upgrade!
    Paper money bank!
    Player Aids!
    Premium cards!
    Revenue Track!
    Upgraded cardboard charters!
Shipping
US shipping:  1 copy $14, 3 copies $29, 6 copies $48, 12 copies $96
Worldwide shipping: 1 copy $25, 3 copies $60, 6 copies $90, 12 copies $180
 Classic 18xx board is also included (reverse side) 
Update April 22: Lonny Orgler has posted his Kickstarter for 1824, a game that helped get me interested in 18xx! Lonny has been a steady supporter of All-Aboard Games since it began. Please support him as well if you are looking for a next step in 18xx.
 18Chesapeake is the perfect introduction to 18xx, both for players new to the system and for experienced players alike to teach their friends or for a quick weeknight session.
Simple rules
Simple map
Simple stock chart
Game advancing mechanism (train exports) that ensures that the game moves along, even if players are timid about advancing them
 Since a lot of players would like to learn the 18xx system with one other player, a two-player variant is included. This variant replicates the feel of a multiplayer game. One key difference from the multiplayer game is that all the President's Certificates (the unique stock certificate that the owner holds), is a triple share. 
There are over 200 18xx games from publishers big and small that showcase a wide variety of railroad history and game mechanisms. By learning 18Chesapeake, players will learn the basic systems that can be easily applied to the more complex games. 
Draft Game Rules

updates.update_content:
Since fulfillment of 18Chesapeake, I've been focusing on bringing other titles into mass production at the quality of 18Chesapeake. Since the remainder of the 18Chesapeake Kickstarter copies are shipping with Wave 2, I wanted to send out the latest AAG newsletter to the 18Chesapeake backers. Sign up for the newsletter here. I try to do approximately monthly updates on what is going on with new games and future plans.
http://tinyletter.com/allaboardgames
AAG August Email Newsletter

With the 18Chesapeake Kickstarter fulfillment wrapping up, I am so grateful for your help backing 18Chesapeake. It’s been awesome seeing some of those copies in play already.
If you haven’t had a chance to play your copy yet, I want to make sure you know about the new free online implementation of 18Chesapeake at https://18xx.games/  It is currently in beta, but it a great implementation and the game enforces most rules so if there is some part of the game you have been wanting to try out, it’s a great way to get started. Or just take a look at games other people are playing. 18Chesapeake is getting a lot of play right now!

It's been very rewarding to see the comments and photos of the new games come in to the various channels I follow. People seem to be really happy with the new art and component quality.
Shipping Update
Europe/worldwide shipping is in progress and I expect it to be completed by this week or early next week. Shipping notices should be sent out with the shipments so please check your spam filter if you haven't received an email by next week.

Today is the big day we've been waiting for as I have word that US and Europe backers that the shipments are in process. I understand that the US/CA shipments should be going out by tomorrow and backers should receive tracking (FedEx, then for most of the US,  transfer to USPS for final delivery). I have heard that some EU backers have received tracking and I expect those to start shipping from Germany in the next week. For non-US/CA backers, these will also ship from Germany.

The freight ships are closing in on their final destinations in the US and Germany and should arrive within about a week. They will be forwarded to the Non-Asia/Australia/New Zealand addresses from there. 
This is a good chance to make any last minute address changes since the fulfillment centers will start the process. Message me within 24 hours if a change is needed. I can still hold orders later to make further changes, but then these might have to go out in a second wave of shipments after the first ones are sent.

Online Playthrough
I'll start with the most immediate news which is that we will be doing the online playthrough today! The game will start about 90 minutes after this update goes out, 11am US Central Time, 6pm Central European Time. Stop by and join the chat if you can!
It will be posted to YouTube for later viewing. The video will be on Chris Whitpan's Game All Nite channel. Chris and Tony Fryer also host a podcast called Wheel Tapping.

While we wait for all the international shipping to happen (still a few weeks of ocean shipping until these reach the US/EU/CA international fulfillment centers), I can at least say that some copies will start appearing for Australia/New Zealand customers very shortly (shipping starting today). Those were air shipped as it didn't make sense to ocean ship this quantity. I'm having the fulfillment centers fulfill orders as they arrive so there will be some gaps between when customers get the games in the different regions--just based on logistics differences.

updates.update_userinfo: Games Have Shipped From the Factory!
updates.update_content:
With all the bad news in the world, we can take a moment for some good news. All the shipments are now sent from the factory!
Australia-New Zealand are being air shipped, should arrive at the fulfillment center soon
Asia are being fulfilled by VFI, should arrive soon
US/Europe/Canada/elsewhere are being ocean shipped and are scheduled to arrive at the fulfillment centers around the end of April. (Canada will take a bit of extra time to reship from US to Canada)

The good news is the factory is up and running and sent me the redone stickers from before Chinese New Year. They look perfect and I'm glad to have waited for that (but if I had only known the extra delays who knows what I would have thought!). But I'm also very eager to get these games into everyone's hands. The factory has the go ahead to assemble and ship the games. Since they have a big backlog of work, they could not commit to a date, but expect they will ship in March. That means the first copies should start arriving in April with fulfillment expected to be complete in May (US/Europe/Canada will take the longest due to ocean shipping times).

Just a quick update to let you all know that the factory is closed this week due to the Coronavirus. They expect the factory to be back at work next week and then I'll have a new shipping date and I'll send a new update when I have that. Apparently this is delaying a lot of KS projects that didn't make the Chinese New Year deadline.
I'm using the extra time to squeeze in all the additional preorders for the first batch of games (18Chesapeake, 1817, 18MEX) submitted thus far into this first shipment. I'll redo the shipping plan on Friday so any orders placed up until Thursday February 13 will be included in the first shipment. The second batch of 2020 games (1822MX, 1849, 18NewEngland, Rolling Stock Stars) is still scheduled to ship in August and I am going to start submitting files for those this week.

campaign.story:
YOU DID IT! We unlocked the Alternate Finale Pack #1 for all Career backers!
Hostage Negotiator: Career is the grand finale to the Hostage Negotiator product line... taking the experience to heights you won't believe!
You've graduated the academy. And now it is time to prove yourself. Can you hold up to the stresses of multiple hostage negotiations? Not to mention the stresses of your career and personal life? Only one way to find out...
The all-in Commissioner (Plus Mat) pledge show here. Click to see in full glory.
Hostage Negotiator: Career requires most of the existing Hostage Negotiator content, and frankly, it is best if you own it all.  But don't worry, if you are missing something you'll be able to fill in the gaps by adding those products to your pledge. 
And if you are new? You have the option of backing for the Lieutenant level which is the minimum required to be able to play HN: Career or what we highly recommend, which is to back at the Commissioner Level for everything in the entire line at an incredible price.
Contents and/or counts are subject to change before final production
 This summary will explain how HN: Career works. It assumes you already know how to play Hostage Negotiator. If you don't, that's ok and we have included some helpful videos down below that will show you everything you need to know!
HN Career is a system that turns your Hostage Negotiator experience into a connected, epic, 10 year campaign. You will experience more than just the tense moments of your negotiations. You'll also experience the key events in the days between them. A campaign will generally take a total of 4-6 hours of game time and the system is completely replayable and the events of the campaign and which Abductors you face will be different each time!
Each campaign round is ONE YEAR of your Career. Many things can happen in a year as you will soon find out. Here we have a look at the Career sheet. 
 As you can see, you will be tracking several stats. You can mark these with pieces while you play, and then circle where you are at the end of your session to save your game. You'll also be recording the results of your negotiations and some key stats from each of them.
Each year in your Career consists of 4 phases: 
1. The Stressor Event phase
Throughout the course of your career, some events will cause you to add a Stressor Card to the Stressor Deck. In this phase, you will draw one Stressor Card at random from the Stressor Deck and resolve it. If there are no cards in the deck, you just move on to the next phase. These cards have a similar format to the Career and Personal event cards which you'll see examples of below.
2. The Career Event phase
In the Career Event phase, you will resolve a Career Card for the year you are in. Most years have 5 different Career Cards, so every Career you play will have many different events! These events will relate more to your career.
 You will be presented with a narrative event and then be given a choice. Choose wisely as your choice will have meaningful impacts on your career!
When you have made your choice, take the Red Decoder and place it over the text on that side of the card to find out the results of your choice. Then you will apply them as indicated.
 For example, in this case, you would increase Personal Stress by 1 and add a random "Cigarettes" Stressor card to the Stressor Deck.
Lastly, you will flip the Career card over and read the Crisis! segment of the card. Usually, this will result in you getting called to the scene of a negotiation and playing a round of Hostage Negotiator against one of the Abductors. You'll usually draw from the Campaign Abductor deck to see which Abductor you will be facing.
3. The Negotiation phase
The Negotiation phase is where you will play a game of Hostage Negotiator against the Abductor randomly chosen from the Campaign Abductor Deck. Make sure you apply any effects from other cards that may effect how the negotiation is set-up. Then you'll play out your negotiation.
When the negotiation ends, record your results on the Career Sheet. What happens in your negotiations could effect things later on!
4. The Personal Event phase
In the Personal Event phase, you will resolve a Personal Card. These are not specific to year like the Career cards. There are 25 different Personal Cards, so you will have a variety of different events each campaign. These events will relate more to your personal life.
Again you will be given a narrative event and a choice and will apply the results of your choice. 
Finally, apply the Negotiation Impacts at the bottom of the Personal card. These impacts will vary based on your success or failure in the negotiation. 
And that would conclude 1 Full Year of Hostage Negotiator Career! You could stop and save, or immediately move on to the next year! I wonder what will happen with that Stressor...
What else can happen? Tell me more!
The answer to that is A LOT! Here are a few more things you can expect to see in the game. 
Stress Checks
During the game you may be asked to make a "Career Stress Check" or a "Personal Stress Check".  When this happens you will roll a die and compare it to the stress level. If the roll is higher than your stress level you pass the check, if not, it is failed.   
 Merit Checks, Rolling for Promotion, and Rank
As your career progresses you may get a chance to be promoted! When this happens you will make a Merit Check. To pass the check and get promoted you need to roll lower than your merit level.   When you get promoted, your Rank will increase. 
At the beginning of the game you will start as an Officer. As your career progresses, you could achieve a rank as high as Captain. Each time your rank increases you will get... oh wait, can't tell you that. But obviously, getting promoted is GOOD and you will be happy!
Rewards
You will earn rewards as you play. These are different things that will give you benefits. Maybe a promotion, some vacation time, or maybe an Advanced Skill! Advanced Skills will direct you to open a special box or envelope that comes with your game. What could be inside???? 
Traits
As you progress, your personality will be formed through your decisions and your skill as a negotiator. You will gain traits based on your decisions. Some may be good, some not so good. What kind of negotiator and person will you be? 
How does it end?
The campaign will usually end after your 10th year although it can end before that with a shameful retirement if you lose too many hostages. If you make it through year 10, you will then play a special end game finale. A climax to your career that can end in a variety of different ways. All of them dramatic. 
We are very excited to offer the final 2 Abductor Packs. One of the new packs is from a veteran game designer, T.C. Petty III and developed by Mikolaj Laczynski. The other is from a new designer and our very own, Shaun Varsos and developed by A.J. Porfirio. These packs, like the others, add a new scenario with new mechanisms and challenges.  All packs are compatible with Hostage Negotiator, Crime Wave, and Career.
 *Please note while we have previously outsourced production of the custom meeples with Meeple Source, for this campaign all of our custom meeples will be produced from our own manufacturer.

Rahdo Runs Through Hostage Negotiator
Maybe you are wondering "Why no videos on the Career Expansion?" 
Here is why:
1) We feel very strongly about keeping the game content and surprises of HN: Career a secret to be discovered by each player upon release. Only a select handful of internal parties and trusted playtesters have experienced the Career Expansion as a prototype. Although it is not "legacy" per se and can be replayed over and over, it has some "legacy-like" elements to it that we don't want spoiled! :)
2) Secondly, the Career expansion provides content that "surrounds" and "enhances" the experience of Hostage Negotiator. So if you don't think you will like Hostage Negotiator based on the videos above, then the Career expansion probably isn't going to change that.
However, because we want you to have a little bit of a taste of what is to come, as part of this Kickstarter we will host a "mini 3 year campaign" and if you own HN and/or Crime Wave (both are available now from your local game store or online from our website at vanrydergames.com!), YOU can play along at home!
Free to play throughout this Kickstarter!
We are supporting a mini-Career campaign during this Kickstarter that will allow YOU to play along with a short 3-year career that will take place throughout the KS campaign! You will be able to experience what the Career expansion will be like by playing along! This is completely free to play (however you must own HN and/or CrimeWave at minimum) and you are under no obligation to back the Career project or do anything else to play along. Having said that, we greatly appreciate any social media shares and any other discussing of the campaign you might feel inclined to do!
So, let’s jump in shall we? Oh, one thing to note real quick. This mini-campaign is completely made up and none of the cards or story events in this mini-campaign are actually in the Career Expansion. The campaign sheet, Officer rank card, rules, and overall structure are, however, exactly the same as what you will find in Career. 
 First things first, go ahead and print this Career Sheet.  
 Set your starting stress levels on the shaded areas, you can circle with a pencil or use a game piece of your choice to track your stats. Go ahead and write your name on your business card as well, so we can get your badge and credentials processed, Officer! Speaking of Officer, here is your Rank Card.  
 Now let’s begin! It is Year 1… 
The first Phase of each year is The Stressor Event phase. In Year 1, you won’t have any Stressors yet so we can skip right on through this for now.
Phase 2 is The Career Event phase. So we have to draw a Career Event card and resolve it. It will be one of several for each given year of the campaign, that you will draw one from at random.  
In some years, you will add new Campaign Abductor cards to the Campaign Abductor deck before resolving the event. In Year 1, you will add the following Abductors to the deck: Arkayne (HN base), Donna (HN base), Edward (HN base), Lijah (HNCW), Seaver (AP6). If you don't own all of these abductors right now, don't worry. Just use what you have.
 Let's take a look at the event...  
Don't worry about finding a red viewfinder, just make your choice and we will reveal the resolutions below!
It really is quite simple… read the text of the event. You have 2 choices. Go ahead and make your choice now… you might want to consider how your choice could impact your stress levels and your life in general. 
Got it? Ok well let’s take a look at the results… to do so, we’ll hold our red viewfinder over the choice we made and resolve it. 
If you decided to "Check the Bulletin Board for Anything of Interest" read the resolution below. Otherwise, scroll past the first one for the resolution to "Head Outside for A Smoke". 
+1 CS means you need to increase your Career Stress. Note that higher stress is NOT a good thing. 
 +1 PS means you need to increase your Personal Stress. Note that higher stress is NOT a good thing. Additionally, you have gained a Stressor. When this happens, we find the Stressor Cards labeled "Cigarettes", shuffle them and put one at random in the Active Stressor Deck. This is the first Stressor you've gotten, so it is the first card in that deck.  
This is not a real Stressor in the game
Whatever you chose, go ahead and adjust the stat on your Career Sheet! If a Stressor was gained, that card was added to the Stressor Deck. One Stressor from the deck will be resolved in the first phase of each Year!
Finally, let’s take a look at the CRISIS! Section of the Career Event card by flipping it upside down… 
The Crisis section is resolved last in Phase 2
It looks like you have a job to do! When your Career starts, only certain Abductors can show up when you draw one at random from the Campaign Abductor Deck.  Now you would draw one to see who you will be playing against in phase 3, the Negotiation Phase. Since this mini-campaign is presented remotely go ahead and select a random abductor from those in the deck (Arkayne, Donna, Edward, Lijah, or Seavers) by a random method of your choice. 
It is now Phase 3 - The Negotiation Phase. Set up and play a game of Hostage Negotiator against the abductor you chose at random. When you are finished, mark the results on your Career Sheet! 
This campaign has continued in the first update of this Kickstarter! Follow the link below to resolve Phase 4 - The Personal Event Phase! Please make sure you allow notifications from this project so you won't miss any updates!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Van Ryder Games has successfully funded and fulfilled many projects. We learn more and more with each experience. Our goal is to get the game to you, our supporters, as quickly as possible, but we won't sacrifice quality for speed.

There are the usual risks of printing, shipping, customs, and other unintended delays, but you can be sure we will deliver the game to you as promised. Feel free to ask any of our returning backers!
A few remarks we want to share with you regarding our approach for our projects, including this one.
1. Communication is of the utmost importance to us. Please ask any and all questions and we will answer as quickly as possible. 
2. Our stretch goal items are determined by us before the campaign begins, in the event all of them are achieved we will not add more as it puts our project timeline and cost at risk. 
3. Your comments and feedback are REALLY important to us. If you have an idea, concern, or compliment, please share it with us! We can't promise to implement or act on every idea that comes our way, but we will certainly consider each one! 
4. We pledge to keep a positive attitude regardless of the success or failure of this project and we ask that you do the same. 
5. To have fun! Kickstarter projects can be stressful, but these are games and the most important thing is to have FUN!

Please note the following is our policy on pledges and refunds.

Refund Policy 

All pledges are final upon the completion of the funding period, however we may, at our sole discretion, refund your pledge in full if the request is made within two weeks of the end of the campaign. Any request for refund after more than two weeks has passed, if accepted by us, will be subject to a 10-20% cancellation fee to account for KS fees and administrative expenses. Please note that, anyone that does not complete the pledge manager by our required deadlines will not be eligible for a refund for any reason, including the assessment of additional shipping fees for expenses related to the delinquency of the survey information.

Abandoned Pledges 

We require that our pledge manager and/or survey be completed in a timely manner so that we can process orders efficiently and on time. Completing your survey late at any point beyond the deadline we communicate, could result in significant delays in receiving your rewards, additional shipping expense, duties, taxes, or other fees to be paid by you, and you will not be eligible for a refund for any reason. We give plenty of time to complete the survey, so please do so in a timely manner to avoid any inconvenience or delay. Any survey that is not completed within 30 days from final fulfillment (defined as the last date of shipping of KS rewards for your region) will result in your pledge being considered abandoned and any amount pledged will be considered a gift in support of the project.

By pledging to this project you understand the risks, challenges, and pledge terms we have laid out here, and agree to be bound by them. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not pledge for this project and wait for the possibility of the game to become available direct or in the retail market.

Unfortunately, as you have probably heard by now, the Corona Virus situation is having major effects in China and, as a result, the factory has not yet reopened. Our manufacturer has informed us that they are tentatively planning to reopen on Feb 17th, but the situation with the Corona Virus could have additional impacts on that date. We are hopeful that they can reopen soon, but at this point the Feb 20 for the goods to leave the factory date previously reported is not going to happen. That, of course, pushes back final delivery as well. We've had delays in the past, but we can honestly say this is the first time that a health epidemic has been the cause. We ask for your patience for just a little bit longer as the picture becomes a bit clearer. Once it does, we will come back to you with some expectations on the dates.

campaign.story:
In 2014, I personally printed, cut and assembled a few hundreds copies of CliniC, in my living room. They were sold out within 2 hours at Spiel, in what was a magical Thursday morning. I've never experienced that before, and in 2015 I released 3 expansions, which were also sold out. The time has come to finally bring that design into the future, and create a beautiful and modern production that does justice to the game.
CliniC Deluxe, the definitive edition of the popular board game inspired by Theme Hospital.
Completely re-envisioned and re-created art and graphic design by Ian O'Toole - including the box, the player boards, the main board, all tiles, and the overall visual identity.
Rewritten and edited game rules, revised for 1-4 players.
An expansion box that contains all previously released expansions (Medical Dossier #1, #2 and #3). 
340+ custom components & many more deluxe features!
Box and Deluxe sleeve
Intensive Care Unit
 We will have very exciting Stretch Goals during this campaign, all developed since 2014 thanks to players' ideas, a big thanks to the geek community that helped me to improve and develop the game during these last 5 years ! 

Pharmacy tile in the expansion box
Among other healthcare visionaries, you seek to build the ideal clinic and serve the needs of the population.You quickly get a pre-admissions facility, and patients are already lining up!
Can you build the clinic of your dreams? Hire doctors, nurses, and maintenance staff! Build new modules, offer specialized treatment, and even build a parking lot or two!
This is your CliniC ! Build it however you see fit and give patients the care they need, and succeed!
Maintenance shop from the expansion box
CliniC presents a set of unique concepts, many of which have not been seen in board games before:
Build the most effective clinic - in 3D! Avoid inefficiency for your doctors and cut time spent moving patients between rooms.
Hire the best doctors and nurses and treat the most patients as possible over the course of the game.
Succeed and make sure you can cover upkeep and salary costs, hopefully even making a profit and driving popularity in the community!
Make enough money to pay the upkeep and salaries and convert the remaining $ into Popularity, the final goal of the game.

Alban Viard is a mathematics teacher. He lives in Beaune, a small city in Burgundy, France. He has designed and developed several boardgames during the last 8 years such as Tramways, Small City, CliniC, Card City XL, Town Center and many expansions for these games. He loves stacking everything and is always impressed by the 3rd dimension.
Ian O’Toole is an Irish illustrator, graphic designer and gamer working out of Perth in Western Australia. He has over fifteen years’ experience working in many creative fields,  producing illustration, design and 3D animation for a broad selection of industries. Ian has created the artwork for such notable boardgames as Lisboa,The Gallerist, Vinhos Deluxe, Escape Plan and more recently Age of Steam and on Mars in April 2019.  Ian works in a wide variety of styles and particularly enjoys drawing from design trends throughout history. Ian works from his home in Perth, where he lives with his wife, two children and dog.
Nathan Morse has edited, translated, and/or written the rules for more than 300 published games, including The Gallerist, Troyes, Lisboa, Vinhos, Kanban, King of Tokyo, Bruxelles 1893, Madeira, Deus, Ginkgopolis, Magic Maze, The Big Book of Madness, Black Angel, Tramways, and Small City. He has a particular hunger for games with emergent complexity, and lots of player agency. Nathan is also obsessed with creating what he calls “holistic summaries” of games and their expansions, which integrate all the rules into a single stream of color-coded instructions; simply skip those you’re not using. He has played and taught more than two thousand different games, and is thrilled to share the joy of a good game with you!
Todd Sanders lives in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, where he works as a graphic designer, publisher and furniture maker. He has great renown as a solo board game designer. Other games should come later this year... I have heard good things about Pulp Invasion, a second stand-alone game in the Pulp Universe with a sci-fi theme...
Many people have worked during the last 5 years on this project. Todd has made a great map to sum up and to locate people around the world.
 A big thanks to Kickstarter that helps us to allow this crazy project!

If you are not familiar with Terraforming Mars, we suggest that you watch one of these great videos to see why Terraforming Mars is an international best seller, and the #4 ranked board game of all time on BoardGameGeek.com! 
We are very excited to be able to offer our Kickstarter backers with a number of great extra items for their support. We will be announcing a new milestone reward every day during this project and every copy of Terraforming Mars: Turmoil sent out to backers of this project will include all these milestone rewards. 
Note that anything marked with these symbols are: 
Promo - An item that Kickstarter backers will get in their rewards, and will not be included in the retail edition of Terraforming Mars: Turmoil. These items may be released at a future date as promotional materials and/or game expansions.
Promo items from this project will be available in the future from all the partners participating in this project, and from all the partners not participating. There is nothing in this project that is exclusive to pledging for this project. Each partner that makes Terraforming Mars will determine how they will distribute promos in their languages after the project ends.  
Terraforming Mars: Turmoil is the biggest and most strategic expansion for the best selling tile placement and card drafting game, Terraforming Mars.  The base game of Terraforming Mars is required to use this expansion. For more information about Terraforming Mars: Turmoil, we encourage you to read our draft rulebook here.
If you are not familiar with Terraforming Mars, we suggest that you watch this great video to learn the rules. You can also read the complete game rules here.
Please note that Terraforming Mars: Turmoil should be considered an EXPERT expansion. This expansion adds a distinct, new level of play as players vie for control of the Terraforming Council, as well as plan for the Global Events.  This expansion will appeal to those who want to play a more expansive game of Terraforming Mars.
Terraforming Mars: Turmoil is the 49th project from the combined teams behind Stronghold Games, Indie Boards and Cards, & Action Phase Games. With the successful execution of our first 48 projects, we have become experienced publishers with a reputation for great games (in design and production) that are delivered in a timely fashion. 
Terraforming Mars: Turmoil was designed by the talented Jacob Fryxelius, and developed by the Fryxelius brothers of FryxGames. This game has undergone extensive testing and development to ensure the best possible experience. We are confident that this game will be in your collection for years to come. 
Terraforming Mars: Turmoil is the fifth expansion that takes players back to Mars for the struggle to control and progress human society. 
Kickstarter is the world's largest funding platform for creative projects. Every month, tens of thousands of people pledge millions of dollars to creative projects in dozens of categories. 
A person who supports a project is called a "backer." The process of giving money to this project is called a "pledge." 
In return for your pledge, we (the creators of the campaign) are able to offer "rewards," depending on the amount you pledge. For example, if you pledge $34 to help back the project, we'll offer you a copy of the game along with any stretch goals we achieve as soon as it is manufactured. 
You can become a backer in just four easy steps: 
 Step 1: Read through the pledge levels and rewards we're offering in the right sidebar of this page. 
 Step 2: Click the large, green "BACK THIS PROJECT" button to the right of the trailer video at the top of this page. 
 Step 3: Enter your pledge amount, and complete the steps for filling in your information. This process takes just a few seconds! That's it! It's really that simple! Thank you for backing!
 Step 4: Shortly after the projects ends on May 5th, we will send you a link to our pledge manager. This is where we will get your shipping information and which language versions of the game you would like to receive.
Once you've backed this project, we encourage you to share this page on social media platforms, such as Facebook and Twitter, and share with your friends and family. Also, be sure to like Stronghold Games on Facebook and follow us on Twitter for real-time updates about this project and more!  
Stronghold Games is excited to offer retailer packages on the English Language editions of Turmoil for Brick and Mortar stores. Many of our partners are also offering retailer packages for their language editions as well.
For more information, please email us at: retailers@indieboardsandcards.com or contact your local language partner directly.
Every backer is important to us, regardless of location, but the reality is that shipping and sales taxes are very expensive and is a cost we all need to share. Risks and challenges
This is the 49th Kickstarter project from the combined teams behind Stronghold Games, Indie Boards and Cards & Action Phase Games. We have learned how to streamline the game publishing process and have successfully delivered all of our previous Kickstarter projects to thousands of supporters. Our previous experiences will enable us to also deliver this project on time and we have every confidence that Terraforming Mars: Turmoil will be on schedule and of the highest possible quality.
That said, there are always complexities and considerations in a project of this scope that may cause delays. Stronghold Games, Indie Boards and Cards, & Action Phase Games will use contract manufacturing to make this game, freight forwarders to get games through customs, and 3rd parties like Amazon, the US Post Office, and FEDEX to ship the games to you – we don't control everything and there are lots of opportunities for delay. We have a track record of making everything work out for backers in the end – so please be confident and supportive of our efforts to get this great game into your hands.

REFUND POLICY
We can refund you within 14 days of the campaign’s end, fees included. campaign.story:
Released in 2017, Anachrony is a worker placement and tableau building game set in a foreboding future. As a leader of one of humanity's four ideological Paths, your goal is to prepare for an asteroid impact bound to happen over the course of the game, and become the dominant power on New Earth once the dust has settled. At your disposal are not only your loyal workers and high-tech Exosuits, but also the ability to open Time Rifts, implemented as an innovative game mechanism.
Since its release, Anachrony has been widely acclaimed as one of the best games in the worker placement category, currently ranking #49 overall on BoardGameGeek, and #37 in the Strategy category.
Anachrony is now back on Kickstarter with Fractures of Time, its biggest expansion to date, and we are also offering an option for collectors old and new: the Infinity Box.
Whether you're a backer of our original Kickstarter campaign, bought the game in your local game store or completely new to the world of Anachrony, this campaign has you covered!
Discover the alternate storyline of Fractures of Time, where secluded areas of New Earth have survived the Day of Purgation. The Amethynia Valley is one of them, where the mysterious flora crystallized in the wake of the cataclysm, fusing with the Neutronium dust. In the following decades, the enigmatic survivors in the Valley learned to extract the precious Flux liquid from these crystalline plants and discovered its ability to create fractures in time.
Explore the Amethynia Valley, the expansion's new main location. Enlist the help of the Operators, a new Worker type specialized in Flux technology, acquire upgrades from the people of the Valley, and most importantly, harvest Flux for yourself and unleash its immense potential! 
As the Paths learned about the Valley and the Flux, they soon realized that the Temporal Fractures can double the efficiency of their deployed Exosuits, essentially enabling them to be present in two places at once. In the new expansion, instead of placing a new Exosuit on your turn, you may spend a Flux Core to move (Blink) an already placed Exosuit from one action space to another.
However, the Fracture Devices developed by the Paths to process Flux are far from perfect. Unless they are properly maintained by the skilled Operators of the Valley, overusing them has an increasing chance to cause temporal Glitches, hindering you in various ways. Fortunately, the Operators are no strangers to these peculiar phenomena, and can also be used to remove Glitches before they overwhelm you.
Formed over the course of the first Era following the discovery of the Time Rifts, the Path of Unity joins the struggle as a fifth faction to save New Earth from the impending cataclysm. Consisting of dissidents from the four other Paths and unified by a common vision, the Path of Unity advocates tolerance and cooperation above all. 
Aurora, the sublime, hovering capital of the Path of Unity is futuristic not only in its looks, but also in its nature. As the first Time Rifts opened, the very foundations of the city have been sent back from the distant future by the collapsing Path of Unity itself. To ensure a flow of events that corrects the course of their history, the Path's finest few, trained for this sole purpose, also emerged from the Time Rift to unite the foreign dissidents following the vision of Aurora, and lead the Path of Unity to a brighter future.
Eldrin: A scientist of unmatched intellect, Eldrin dedicated his life to perfecting the Fracture technology for the Path of Unity. He developed his own methods for keeping the dangers of the Fracturedevice at bay, something only the Valley’s Operators have been capable of.
Castien: The stalwart Castien was raised in the Valley from a young age, and is a living embodiment of the alliance between the Amethynians and the Path of Unity. Under his command, the Operators are willing to risk an incredibly dangerous feat: traversing the same Fracture more than once. 
Thalia:  As the third member of the Triumvirate, the first generation Leaders of the Path of Unity, Thalia was raised to lay the foundations of Aurora. Thanks to her social skills, charisma and information network, she always finds a way to achieve her goals by manipulating her political opponents. 
Find out more about the new Leaders in the New Leaders section at the bottom of the campaign page.
In Fractures of Time, we continued to develop Anachrony's popular solo mode, the Chronobot. You will find a double-sided solo board with two new solo opponents in all three pledge levels:
The Chronobot Omega version of the Chronobot is very similar to the original one, but works with less randomness. Just like the last version, it is only playable with the base game.
The Chronossus is a whole new, reworked and slightly more complex iteration of the Chronobot. It is better at simulating passing, it has more customizable difficulty levels, and by using Flux and the Blink mechanism, it is compatible with Fractures of Time. It can also be played with the Doomsday and the Pioneers of New Earth modules.

If you are interested in the rules in a greater detail, check out our current work-in-progress rulebook, and the latest Gaming Rules! Video, where you can watch David explain the rules in detail followed by a full three-player playthrough of Anachrony: Fractures of Time. If you want to try it out yourself, check out the free digital version on Tabletopia!




This is the retail version of the expansion, but this pledge level will include some stretch goals that may not be available in retail.
If you are new to the world of Anachrony, the Infinity Box pledge level was made for you! It includes the base game, all expansions and modules released up to and including Fractures of Time, and all stretch goals.
If you own a Leader Box form the original Anachrony campaign, or the base box and the Exosuit Commander Pack from retail, the Infinity Upgrade Pack allows you to seamlessly upgrade your copy to the Infinity Box. If you only own the base game but would like to upgrade to the Infinity Box, you will also need the Exosuit Commander Pack add-on (see the Add-ons section).





The above items are optional purchases in addition to your current pledge. To add them to your pledge, simply click Manage your Pledge, then increase your pledge amount by the total cost of the items you wish to add. In the Pledge Manager following the campaign, you will be able to allocate the funds added this way to the respective add-ons.
Please note that the Exosuit Commander Pack add-on can only be added to the Infinity Upgrade Pack pledge level, and only once per Infinity Upgrade Pack pledged.

In this campaign, we introduced a slightly different, thematic take on the Stretch Goal system, diverging from the ones you may be used to. For more details on our Journey through Time, check out Update#1!
The discovery of the final Origin Timeline introduced Future Imperfect, a whole new expansion consisting of three modules with various scopes and complexities, adding more variety to the time travel and endgame scoring mechanisms.
The Origin timeline is the final destination of our Journey through Time, and with it, we have unlocked all stretch goals we planned for this campaign. Thank you very much for your amazing support!
If you are interested in the previous timelines, the content they unlocked, and their story, check out Updates 1, 2, 6, 8, 10 and 15!

For a full playthrough video, check out Tom's Youtube channel, Slickerdrips!
In this campaign, we have committed to a transparent and clear standpoint regarding our exclusivity policy on Kickstarter and beyond.
The Infinity Box, Infinity Upgrade Pack, and certain stretch goals are marked with the MCG Exclusive badge on the campaign page. Items with this badge will only be printed once, following this Kickstarter campaign. We will be printing approximately 15% more of these items than what we'd normally need to fulfill the Kickstarter pledges and the Pledge manager orders. This additional quantity is primarily a safety buffer for the fulfillment. Once the fulfillment is 100% complete, we will be selling the remaining copies only on conventions and on our webshop.
With this exclusivity policy, we commit to the following:
We won't sell any of our MCG Exclusive items into retail after the Pledge Manager is closed. The only way for these items to enter retail is if a retailer pledges for them during the Campaign or the Pledge Manager.
We guarantee that the current Kickstarter price of these items is lower than it will be in the Pledge Manager for new late pledges*, at our convention booths and on our webshop.
 *If you pledge during this campaign, you will still be able to add more items in the Pledge Manager for the same prices you see on the campaign page.
Anachrony and all of its modules and expansions are completely language-independent - once you know the rules, you don't need any English knowledge to play the game.
The process of translating, quality controlling and printing multiple rulebooks in the Infinity Box would add several weeks to the lead time of the project, and would increase the box weight significantly which would incur increased shipping prices for you. For these reasons, the game will only ship with English rulebooks, but we will be working on translating the rulebooks and the player aids to the following languages:
These rulebooks and player aids will be available as digital PDFs as a free download from Boardgamegeek and our new website.
The retail version of Anachrony is available localized in several languages, and we are in talks with those publishing partners to release the Fractures of Time expansion later. Note that the Infinity Box itself will not be released in localized versions, as promised in our exclusivity policy.
If you are a brick-and-mortar retailer or organizing a private group pledge, please contact us at balazs.horvath@mindclashgames.com for our retail and group pledge offers. Thank you!
As with our previous campaigns, we will be working with shipping partners within the EU, US, Canada, Australia and Asia to provide region-friendly shipping in each of these zones. If you live in these regions, you will not have to worry about paying additional taxes or duties.
The shipping cost will be charged after the campaign, using the pledge manager. campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is Mindclash Games' fifth Kickstarter campaign. Three of those campaigns have already shipped, and the fourth is already in production, allowing us to fully focus on the successful execution of this project.

This campaign is slightly bigger in scope than our previous one (Trickerion - Dahlgaard's Academy and Collector's Edition), but since the end of that campaign, our core team has doubled in size. We now have fully dedicated people working in customer service, community management, operations and creative direction, ready for the new campaign and everything it entails.

We have launched Fractures of Time on Kickstarter in a much more advanced state than any of our previous games. We've been known for going above any beyond in polishing our games, even after the Kickstarter is finished, which sometimes resulted in a slightly different end product than what you saw on the Kickstarter page. That won't be the case now - we are not cutting any corners this time either, simply most of the said polishing is already done! With the Infinity Box being as complex of a product as it is, we have also added more safety buffer to our delivery estimates than before. We are very confident that we will deliver this project on time.

In manufacturing, we will continue to work with Panda GM. They have been excellent partners for all our projects so far, and our four-year partnership is a guarantee for smooth communication and an inside-out knowledge of their processes and deadlines. We are certain that the quality of the new expansion and the Infinity Box will more than meet your expectations!

We highly value transparency in all our campaigns. We will be in touch about our progress and important milestones via regular project updates, but if you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to contact us at info@mindclashgames.com.

campaign.story:
Following the success of unmanned rover missions, the United Nations established the Department of Operations and Mars Exploration (D.O.M.E.). The first settlers arrived on Mars in the year 2037 and in the decades after establishment Mars Base Camp, private exploration companies began work on the creation of a self-sustaining colony. 
Scientists
As chief astronaut for one of these enterprises, you want to be a pioneer in the development of the biggest, most advanced colony on Mars by achieving both D.O.M.E. mission goals as well as your company’s private agenda. 
In the beginning, you will be dependent on supplies from Earth and will have to travel often between the Mars Space Station and the planet's surface. 
As the colony expands over time, you will shift your activities to construct mines, power generators, water extractors, greenhouses, oxygen factories, and shelters. Your goal is to develop a self-sustaining colony independent of any terrestrial organization. This will require understanding the importance of water, air, power, and food — the necessities for survival.
Do you dare take part in humankind’s biggest challenge?
Rovers, Robots and Ships
On Mars is played over several rounds, each consisting of two phases - the Colonization Phase and the Shuttle Phase. 
During the Colonization Phase, each player takes a turn during which they take actions. The available actions depend on the side of the board they are on. If you are in orbit, you can take blueprints, buy and develop technologies, and take supplies from the Warehouse. If you are on the surface of the planet, you can construct buildings with your bots, upgrade these buildings using blueprints, take scientists and new contracts, welcome new ships, and explore the planet’s surface with their rover.  
In the Shuttle Phase, players may travel between the colony and the Space Station in orbit. 
All buildings on Mars have a dependency on each other and some are required for the colony to grow. Building shelters for Colonists to live in requires oxygen; generating oxygen requires plants; growing plants requires water; extracting water from ice requires power; generating power requires mining minerals; and mining minerals requires Colonists.  
Upgrading the colony’s ability to provide each of these resources is vital. As the colony grows, more shelters are needed so that the Colonists can survive the inhospitable conditions on Mars. 
During the game, players are also trying to complete missions. Once a total of three missions have been completed, the game ends. 
To win the game, players must contribute to the development of the first colony on Mars. This is represented during the game by players gaining Opportunity Points (OP). The player with the most OP at the end of the game is declared the winner.

Vital Lacerda has designed a prolific list of euro strategy games including The Gallerist, Vinhos Deluxe, Lisboa, Escape Plan and On Mars.  He has a master's degree in Marketing and Advertising. His game designs center around the theme of the game and heavily incorporate intertwined mechanics. Vital lives in Portugal with his wife, Sandra, and two daughters. He enjoys extreme sports such as snowboarding and kitesurfing.  
Ian O’Toole is an Irish illustrator, graphic designer and gamer working out of Perth in Western Australia. He has over fifteen years’ experience working in many creative fields,  producing illustration, design and 3D animation for a broad selection of industries. Ian has created the artwork for such notable boardgames as Lisboa,The Gallerist, Vinhos Deluxe, Escape Plan and The Scarlet Pimpernel.  Ian works in a wide variety of styles and particularly enjoys drawing from design trends throughout history. Ian works from his home in Perth, where he lives with his wife, two children and dog.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
At Eagle-Gryphon Games we stand by our products, but sometimes issues do happen. Please contact our customer service department with regard to any such issues within 90 days of receiving your copy of the game.

Eagle-Gryphon Games has completed 90+ Kickstarter projects to date. All of those projects have either been completely delivered or are in production right now.

We will always do our best through Kickstarter Updates to keep you as informed as possible as to the status of your game(s). However, in this business some uncertain factors are beyond our control, such as holidays, customs, quality control, inspection delays, inclement weather and dock strikes - to name a few. Please understand we have little to no control over such factors. We assure you that you will be the first to know any developments as we learn them.

Put simply: you will get everything we promise to you when you pledge to one of our Kickstarter projects, and it will be delivered to you in as timely a manner as possible.

Shipping issues are relatively uncommon, but they do sometimes occur. We double check all of your games for damage before sending them to you. However, there is a chance that your games may get damaged during shipping by the carrier. If your package is damaged, please contact us so we can assist you.

We will not ship to Russia, the Ukraine and certain places in Asia and the rest of the world, except for specially-made arrangements wherein the Backer takes the risk involved in receiving the package.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: On Mars: Alien Invasion - Coming to KS May 13th - 28th
updates.update_content: With the success of the Perseverance landing on Mars by NASA (https://mars.nasa.gov/mars2020/timeline/landing/watch-online/) we thought it would be the perfect day to share news on the upcoming On Mars expansion in our new weekly vlog:

To UK backers -- Angus at Board Game Guru gave us an Update a few hours ago. He says that all On Mars and Age of Steam games to UK backers have been shipped out except for 31 parcels that are joint Age of Steam and On Mars packaged together; and 21 more parcels that need signature stickers packed along with the game. He believes that he has everything he needs to do these shipments. He tells us that he has had issues with sick personnel and that he has had to do much of the work by himself, but that he will have these last 52 parcels packed and out the door (he hopes) by Friday, Feb 21. Failing that, he promises to work on the weekend of Feb 22-23 and at the drop dead latest, he will be done on Monday, Feb. 24. This info all comes from Angus and we are reporting it to you as best and as quickly as we get it with no attempt to ignore or anger or frustrate you. This is the best thing (and the only thing) we can do about this particular situation, which frustrates us as well. However, we will take all necessary measures needed to prevent this from happening again in the future.

Dear UK Backers --
Obviously, fulfillment to our UK Backers has not gone smoothly and about 30% of you have yet to receive your On Mars copies.  Over 400 On Mars individual copies were sent out to UK Backers from Firestorm Cards in the first seven days of January, just as soon as Firestorm Cards came back from the Christmas/New Years break. However, Angus at BoardGameGuru has told us today that he has just finished fulfillment of all the other 5 campaigns (a total of 386 orders for The City, Railways of Portugal, Maniacal, Football Highlights 2052, and Age of Steam Deluxe) that he was doing for us in December and January, and that he is now ready to start to fulfill the 198 orders we gave him to do for On Mars.

LOG ENTRY, 2092 – SOL 103:
With our expedition to the north side of the crater complete, we set our sights extracting as much data as we can in hopes of improving conditions for the colony.
Konrad Mamoa
Canadian Fulfillment of Single Copies of On Mars

I will keep the order of countries/situations the same in this Update #44 as it was in Update #43 for easier reading and finding info.

Here is an overview of the entire On Mars fulfillment picture, region by region.  Keep in mind that the On Mars games finished production and packaging and were ready to be shipped from the factory between November 10 and 15 (i.e. they were not all ready on the same date but rolled out over the course of a week). campaign.story:
Hey there, welcome to THE ULTIMATE DESKMAT KICKSTARTER. 
A couple questions right up top:  
Is computer use a part of the daily routine for you or a loved one?  
Have you been wanting to jazz up your workspace, but been drawing blanks as to how?  
If you answered yes to either of those questions, you're in the right place!  Continue scrolling down to discover just what it is that makes this project so special. 
Step 1: Increase your style points at the office with one of our many styles to choose from. 
Step 2: Express yourself through artwork that resonates with you. 
Step 3: ????
Step 4: Profit 
Last Epoch is an incredible new Action RPG and we're thrilled to be partnering with Eleventh Hour Games to bring a bundle that includes the game and one Deskmat of your choice! Get access to the beta as soon as the KS ends, and a one of a kind Deskmat all for a killer deal you won't find anywhere else!! The incredible art in game is thanks to the artist: Sergey Ashihmin  https://www.artstation.com/ashihmin 
"Why did we seek out this partnership? We first encountered Eleventh Hour Games at Pax South 2019. In the sea of AAA game companies and T-shirt towers, Last Epoch stood out to us. Personally, action RPGs are my favorite genre, I’ve been playing Diablo since I was 9. So naturally I geeked out about their game. At PAX east I got to meet the team and see how much love and hard work they put into their game. That’s the same passion we put into our products and it made it very apparent that I wanted to work with them." 
-Nolan Nasser, Founder of N3 Art
We set out to Kickstart the Ultimate Deskmat for a couple of different reasons. The first is that we've been asked over and over again, via social media and at our convention booth- "When can I get one that covers my whole desk?"  To all of our incredible, patient customers, we're happy to announce, it's finally here!  
The second reason is that as a company, we want to transition toward becoming a platform that isn't just about designing the greatest products that we can, but a company that uses it's arsenal of great products to help budding artists blossom. Moving forward N3 will be re-branding as an art collective, and we will be doing everything that we can to help artists position themselves to start getting paid. Supporting this project directly supports us on that mission. 
"My main mission while working with other Artists is to elevate and empower them to fuel their creativity. I was really lucky to have a supportive family, create a stable business, and build connections that allowed me to focus on just creating art. I want to be able to provide that same sense of security to other passionate and driven creators.
One way I approach that is by providing access to sales channels and manufacturing that might otherwise be difficult to reach. The other is by compensating artists well, and paying up front for their work. I built my reputation on reliability and hard work so I want to extend the same thing to like minded creators."
-Nolan 
Click to check out Cody's work at Heady Scarf Gang!
Cody is the founder of Heady Scarf Gang, a clothing brand that has it’s roots planted in the electronic music scene. For the first time official HSG artwork is branching out to other products. We’re excited to feature Cody and Heady Scarf Gang’s line of geometric art.   
Click to check out Bebo's gaming community, BeBold Games
Bebo is a power house in the tabletop industry, if you're not following her you should fix that. Her How to Play's are not only the highest quality you'll find, but she also does an amazing job cultivating a welcoming and inclusive gaming community. Bebo is an especially skilled creator and we're thrilled to get to work with her.
Click to check out Colin's incredible illustrations!
Colin was one of Nolan's illustration mentors in college and an incredibly skilled artist. Nolan and Colin have been working on projects together for years, including Tabletop RPGs, Board games, and sharing their personal work with each other. It's an honor to get to produce some of Colin's work here! 
We'll be working with Backer Kit to bring you a pledge manager almost immediately after the Kickstarter ends! We're looking to fulfill this project as smoothly and as quickly as possible and Backerkit helps in that process. After the campaign you'll receive a survey where you can easily pick which style deskmat you want!

As a team this is our 8th kickstarter so we're familiar with the process and you can count on us. We'll be transparent and communicative about any sort of problems! However, we anticipate the chance for error to be exceptionally low!
